The PERFECT weekend Breakfast 😍 PROTEIN FRENCH TOAST⁠
⁠
Follow @eats.with.t for more high-protein and delicious recipes! ⁠
⁠
492 calories (serves 1)⁠
45g P l 52g C l 10g F⁠
⁠
TOAST -⁠
3 slices of sourdough bread⁠
1 whole egg & 1 egg white⁠
Splash of milk⁠
Vanilla essence⁠
Cinnamon⁠
⁠
RICOTTA WHIP -⁠
100g light ricotta⁠
20g @vpa_australia WPI birthday cake flavour 🍰⁠
⁠
METHOD -⁠
🍓 Whisk together egg, milk, cinnamon & vanilla essence. Once well combined, add in the sourdough, and let the bread soak up the mixture for about 10 seconds on each side.⁠
🫐 On medium heat, cook the sourdough for about 3 minutes, or until golden brown, then turn over and cook on the other side. Repeat.⁠
🍓While cooking, mix ricotta cheese & protein powder in a small bowl and set aside.⁠
🫐 Top with berries, ricotta & maple syrup.⁠
⁠
*you can use Country Split bread for a lower-carb alternative.⁠
* if you don’t like ricotta and still want to hit your protein, you can add protein powder to the French toast mixture⁠
⁠
Enjoy 🤤🤤

Looking for the perfect mid-week sweet treat? Look no further!⁠
⁠
APRICOT BLISS BALLS 🧡 by @eats.with.t⁠
⁠
It is the perfect little sweet snack with only 7 ingredients and is SUPER simple to make. Using our local sunnidais granola, these balls are PACKED full of the good stuff 😋⁠
⁠
159 calories per ball - 8g P I 16g C I 5g F⁠
⁠
INGREDIENTS⁠
30g @sunnidais_by_kylie granola⁠
40g @vpa_australia caramel white milk WPI⁠
60g sun-dried apricots⁠
60g / 3 medijool dates (pitted & soaked)⁠
8g desiccated coconut⁠
10g peanut butter⁠
30g oats⁠
⁠
METHOD⁠
🧡add 3 medjool dates to a bowl, cover with bowling water and let them soak for about 5 minutes/until soft.⁠
🧡add all ingredients to a food processor and blitz until well combined.⁠
🧡 divide mixture into 6 and roll into balls.⁠
🧡optional (but highly recommended) - drizzle with some melted caramilk chocolate 🤤🤤

Raspberry & White Choc Baked Oats 🍫⁠
⁠
Per Serve: 497 calories - 32g protein - 13g fat - 60g carbs - 11g fibre⁠
⁠
INGREDIENTS:⁠
- 70g Banana, Mashed⁠
- 50g Rolled Oats⁠
- 10g Black Chia Seeds⁠
- 100ml Lite Milk⁠
- 20g VPA Vanilla Whey⁠
- 1/4 Tsp Baking Powder⁠
- 50g Frozen Raspberries⁠
- 10g White Choc Chips⁠
⁠
METHOD:⁠
Preheat oven to 180 degrees. Combine all ingredients in an oven-safe dish. Bake for 30 minutes or until golden and cooked through.⁠
�NOTE: This recipe makes one serve - I did mine in individual containers and added the individual ingredients to each container. IF you want to make one batch, just multiply the ingredients - usually 4 x is for a baking dish tray size.⁠
⁠
#oats #oatmeal #bakedoats #breakfast #breakfastideas #breakfastrecipes #highprotein #highproteinbreakfast #mealprep #mealplan #easyrecipes #highfiber⁠

Apple Pie Overnight Oats 🍎🥧⁠
⁠
Recipe by: @danica.dedic⁠
⁠
Serves 4 - Per Serve⁠
457 calories - 25g protein - 15g fat - 54g carbs⁠
⁠
INGREDIENTS:⁠
- 275g Apple, Diced (aprox 2 apples)⁠
- 25g Queen’s Pure Canadian Maple Syrup⁠
- 1 Tsp Ground Cinnamon⁠
- 500ml Lite Milk⁠
- 5g Queens Natural Vanilla Extract⁠
- Pinch of Salt⁠
- 200g Rolled Oats⁠
- 30g Vanilla VPA Whey Isolate⁠
- 1/2 Tsp Ground Cinnamon⁠
- 1/4 Tsp Ground Ginger⁠
- 1/8 Tsp Ground Nutmeg⁠
- 15g Chia Seeds⁠
- 200g Chobani Natural Light Yoghurt⁠
- 40g Walnuts⁠
⁠
METHOD:⁠
Add diced apples to a pan with maple syrup and cinnamon over a medium heat. Once apples begin to sizzle, cover and cook for 5 minutes. Remove lid and cook for an extra 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.⁠
⁠
In a large bowl, add milk, vanilla extract and salt. Add 1/4 cup of apple mixture. Use a stick blender to mix and create apple flavoured milk. Add in oats, vanilla whey, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg and chia seeds. Mix to combine and set aside for an hour to absorb.⁠
⁠
Divide mixture into 4 seperate glass jars/containers (I like to add some apple mixture half way). Top with greek yoghurt, remaining apples and walnuts. Refrigerate overnight. These will store in the fridge for up to 5 days in an air tight container.⁠
⁠
*If you don’t have a stick blender use a normal blender⁠
*Use rolled oats as better texture than quick oats⁠
*Can remove protein powder if you don’t want to utilise it - calories and macro will be altered⁠
⁠
#overnightoats #mealprep #breakfast #breakfastprep #highproteinbreakfast #breakfastrecipe

Cost vs convenience 💁‍♂️

When it comes to consuming protein through protein powders and pre made products, you’ll always encounter the trade up of cost 💰 vs. convenience 💨 

If I’m making a protein smoothie, protein pancakes (this tends to happen quite a bit) or just a normal protein shake, I’d choose a high quality, yet, cost effective protein from @vpa_australia 

However, if I’m on the go and I haven’t prepared myself, I’d opt in for something like a @rokebynutrition protein smoothie. 

@vpa_australia is going to save you a pretty penny compared to constantly buying the @rokebynutrition however, the latter can come in handy when you’re not prepared. 

Both delicious, and both fighting on the frontline against muscle atrophy 💪 

I hope this helps you to choose the right tool for job 🔨

Here's a super simple and super time-effective overnight oats recipe for you to follow: ⁠
⁠
Recipe: @danica.dedic⁠
⁠
412 calories - 41g protein - 9g fat - 36g carbs⁠

Let's chat all things Creatine with @coachmichaelstone!⁠
⁠
"Rigorously studied, Creatine monohydrate has been shown to increase muscle gain, strength, high-intensity exercise performance and even shows early signs of supporting brain health in the elderly and recovery in TBI patients (possibly Jake Paul in future) 🧠⁠
⁠
I don’t often recommend supplements to clients as a balanced diet is going to provide the majority of your nutrition needs, however, we only produce a limited amount of creatine naturally and can only consume small amounts through food - so, for those who want that extra bit of support, look no further than the white powder that you don’t put up your nose 👃⁠
⁠
As a general rule of thumb, 3-5g of creatine per day is enough to gradually saturate your stores and maintain them for ergogenic effect." ⁠
⁠
Thanks for your insight on Creatine Monohydrate, Michael! Make sure to drop him a follow for more!⁠
⁠

Double Choc Blended Overnight Oats 🍫⁠
⁠
Recipe: @danica.dedic⁠
⁠
590 calories - 47g protein - 20g fat - 49g carbs⁠
⁠
INGREDIENTS:⁠
- 50g Quick Oats⁠
- 10g Chia Seeds⁠
- 10g Cocoa Powder⁠
- 30g VPA Dark Chocolate Whey⁠
- 100g Lite Milk⁠
- 50g Chobani Light Greek Yoghurt⁠
- 20g 70% Dark Chocolate⁠
- 2g Coconut Oil⁠
- (OPTIONAL - Creatine)⁠
⁠
METHOD:⁠
Combine oats, chia seeds, cocoa powder, whey, milk, and yogurt in a blender. Blitz to combine and place in a container in the fridge overnight to set. Once set melt chocolate and oil and pour over. Place in the fridge again until set.⁠
⁠
#oats #oatmeal #overnightoats #overnightoatsrecipe #blendedoats #chocolateoats #proteinoats #proteinbreakfast #breakfast #mealprep #highfibre #highprotein

🌟 What are EAAs & Why You Need Them! 🌟⁠
⁠
💪 EAAs (Essential Amino Acids) are the building blocks of protein that your body can’t produce on its own! You’ve got to get them through food or supplements.⁠
⁠
🔥 What do they do?⁠
 1️⃣ Boost Muscle Recovery – Repair and grow muscle faster post-workout 💥⁠
2️⃣ Enhance Endurance – Keep going stronger, longer ⏳⁠
3️⃣ Prevent Muscle Breakdown – Protect that hard-earned muscle from being used as energy 💯⁠
4️⃣ Support Overall Health – Crucial for immune function, energy production & more! ⚡⁠
⁠
👉 Want to take your training to the next level? Add EAAs to your routine for ultimate gains and recovery! 💪✨ P.S We currently have a Frugal Friday offer where you can cop EAAs for FREE when you sped $100!⁠

Rise and Grind, VPA Fam! ⚡️⁠
⁠
How’s your running nutrition looking?⁠
⁠
Check out our top tips for fueling your run before, during, and after!⁠
⁠
Pre-Run: Fuel up with simple carbs (banana, toast) and hydrate 1-2 hours before. Need an extra boost? Add a pre-workout!⁠
⁠
During Run: Stay hydrated! Sip water every 15-20 minutes, and for those longer runs, grab an energy gel.⁠
⁠
Post-Run: Recover right with a protein-carb combo (shake, fruit) within 30 minutes, and don’t forget to rehydrate.⁠

🥕 CARROT CAKE OATS 🥕 by: @eats.with.t⁠
⁠
Macros (including toppings) - 599 cals⁠
C - 72.2, P - 40.8, F - 16.9⁠
⁠
Ingredients -⁠
🥕 25g VPA WPI - Caramel white milk flavour⁠
🥕 60g oats⁠
🥕 5g chia seeds⁠
🥕 70g carrot (grated)⁠
🥕 15g sultanas⁠
🥕 10g walnuts (chopped)⁠
🥕 Cinnamon & nutmeg to taste⁠
⁠
Method -⁠
1. Add oats, chia seeds, and water to a pot on medium heat, and mix and cover.⁠
2, While oats are cooking, grate carrot & chop walnuts. Stir in the carrot, sultanas & half of the walnuts to the oats.⁠
3. Once the oats have thickened, add protein powder, cinnamon, nutmeg & stir. 4. Add more water if required. Cover again and cook until desired consistency. I don’t like mine runny so I cook mine a little longer.⁠
5. Once done, add to a bowl & top with salted caramel YoPro, maple syrup & the remaining walnuts⁠
⁠
Enjoy! 🥕🐰⁠
⁠

WPC vs. WPI! Ever wondered what the difference is? Here's a simple breakdown:⁠
⁠
When deciding between VPA Australia’s WPI and WPC, it all comes down to your goals, dietary preferences, and budget! 🎯💡⁠
⁠
WPI is the ideal choice for those prioritizing performance 🏋️‍♀️, lactose sensitivity 🥛🚫, or weight management ⚖️. On the other hand, WPC is perfect if you’re after a more affordable 💸, nutritionally balanced 🥗, and delicious 😋 protein supplement 💪.⁠

Chunky Monkey Protein Ice Cream 🍌🍫 Recipe by: @danica.dedic 😍⁠
⁠
Whole tub (large ninja creami tub) - 493 calories - 35g protein - 20g fat - 48g carbs⁠
⁠
INGREDIENTS:⁠
- 100g Banana⁠
- 250ml Unsweetened Almond Milk⁠
- 100ml Lite Milk⁠
- 30g VPA Banana Whey Isolate⁠
- 5g Cottee’s Instant Pudding Powder (Vanilla)⁠
- 15g Walnuts⁠
- 15g Dark Choc Chips⁠
⁠
METHOD:⁠
In a blender add banana, almond milk, lite milk, banana whey and pudding powder. Blitz until combine and transfer to ninja creami tub and freeze for 24 hours. Place in ninja creami on lite ice cream. Add a dash more liquid and respin. Add 3/4 walnuts and dark choc chips and hit mix in. Top with remaining walnuts and dark choc and enjoy!⁠
⁠

Choc Chip Oat Pancakes With Banana & Maple Syrup 🥞⁠
⁠
561 calories - 34g protein - 15g fat - 71g carbs⁠
⁠
INGREDIENTS:⁠
- 1 x Whole Egg⁠
- 30g Chobani Natural Light Greek Yoghurt⁠
- 35g Lite Milk⁠
- 35g Quick Oats⁠
- 20g VPA Vanilla Whey Isolate⁠
- 5g Natvia Natural Sweetener⁠
- 2g Baking Powder⁠
- 20g Cadbury Dark Baking Chips⁠
- 90g Banana⁠
- 15g Queen Pure Canadian Maple Syrup⁠
⁠
METHOD:⁠
Combine egg, yoghurt and milk and mix to combine. Blitz oats in a food process or blender to turn into a flour. Add to liquids along with whey, sweetener and baking powder. Mix to combine and add in baking chips mixing through. Heat a non stick pan over a low heat and cook pancakes individually, flipping half way, until all batter has been used. Serve with sliced banana and maple syrup!⁠
⁠
#pancake #proteinpancake #pancakes #oatpancakes #healthyrecipe #breakfast #breakfastrecipes #highproteinbreakfast

CALLING ALL COFFEE LOVERS 🚨☕️⁠
⁠
Tiramisu Baked Oats ☕️🍫 baked by none other than @danica.dedic 😍⁠
⁠
Serves 4⁠
Per Serve - 445 calories - 30g protein - 12g fat - 62g carbs - 8g fibre⁠
⁠
INGREDIENTS:⁠
- 280g Banana (2 Bananas - Ripe!)⁠
- 200g Quick Oats⁠
- 60g VPA Iced Coffee Whey Isolate⁠
- 5g Baking Powder⁠
- 5g Vanilla Extract⁠
- 400ml Lite Milk⁠
- 1 Tsp Instant Coffee (With 1/2 Cup Boiling Water)⁠
⁠
Topping:⁠
- 100g Light Cream Cheese⁠
- 150g Chobani Natural Light Greek Yoghurt⁠
- 5g Cadbury Cocoa Powder⁠
⁠
METHOD:⁠
Preheat oven to 180 degrees and line a baking dish. Combine banana, oats, whey, baking powder, vanilla extract, light milk and coffee. Mix to combine and transfer to baking dish. Bake in oven for 30-40 minutes or until cooked through. Allow to fully cool. Mix together cream cheese and greek yoghurt. Spread over oats, and dust with cocoa. Slice into 4 portions. ��Can be stored for 4 days.⁠
⁠

VPA had the privilege of spending an evening with Wayne Bennett at LightSpace in Fortitude Valley last Thursday. Here are nine key insights he shared:⁠
⁠
1. It’s not how you win; it’s how you play.⁠
2. If your business faced the same level of scrutiny as the NRL, you wouldn’t have a company.⁠
3. Trust and happiness are what matter in a workplace.⁠
4. "It’s either them or me." – Tommy Raudonikis.⁠
5. "If you lose your passion, it’s time to move on." – Advice from his first coach at Canberra.⁠
6. You can’t be successful without a plan.⁠
7. Show loyalty to performance.⁠
8. I would rather go to war with 100 men willing to die than 1,000 who don’t want to be there.⁠
9. Know what it takes to win.⁠
⁠
⁠
Thank you to Wayne Bennett and the Dolphins for an unforgettable evening. Your insights have left a lasting impact, and we're excited to apply these lessons. We truly appreciate the opportunity to learn from the best!⁠
⁠

⁠
Banana Bread Baked Oats 🍌🍫⁠
⁠
Makes 4 Serves⁠
Per Serve: 473 calories - 26g protein - 16g fat - 55g carbs⁠
⁠
INGREDIENTS:⁠
- 230g Banana, Mashed⁠
- 200g Quick Oats⁠
- 60g VPA Vanilla Whey Isolate⁠
- 40g Walnuts, Chopped⁠
- 40g Dark Choc Chips⁠
- 1 Tsp Baking Powder⁠
- 1 Tsp Cinnamon⁠
- 5ml Vanilla Extract⁠
- 400ml Lite Milk⁠
⁠
METHOD:⁠
Preheat your oven to 180 degrees and line a baking dish. Combine all ingredients in a mixing bowl and mix until combined. Transfer to a baking dish and bake for 35 minutes or until golden and cooked through. Remove from oven, serve, and enjoy!��This will last for 4 days (meal prep slay).⁠
⁠

🌙 Struggling to get some shut-eye? 😴 ⁠
⁠
💡 Here's 8 tips you may not know that can help you get better sleep ⬇️⁠
⁠
🌞 Get natural sunlight: Exposure to natural sunlight during the day helps keep your circadian rhythm healthy, improving daytime energy and nighttime sleep quality.⁠
⁠
🍽️ Balanced diet: A diet rich in whole foods like fruits, veggies, and quality proteins can contribute to better sleep quality. ⁠
⁠
📱 Screen time: Limit screens before bed. Cutting out devices like iPads and smartphones before bedtime can promote better sleep quality.⁠
⁠
☕ Watch your caffeine intake: Caffeine can stay elevated in your blood for 6–8 hours, so avoid large amounts of coffee after 3–4 p.m., especially if you’re sensitive to caffeine.⁠
⁠
⏰ Consistency: Stick to a consistent sleep schedule. Consistency is key for your body’s circadian rhythm, aligning itself with sunrise and sunset, which aids long-term sleep quality.⁠
⁠
🍴 Avoid late-night eating: Snacking late at night may negatively affect sleep quality and the natural release of HGH and melatonin. ⁠
⁠
🛁 Pre-sleep routine: Establish a pre-sleep routine to help you relax. Strategies like listening to relaxing music, taking a hot bath, meditating and deep breathing can all contribute to better sleep.⁠
⁠
💊 Consider supplements: ZMA6 supports recovery, enhances sleep quality, and provides essential minerals for your nervous system.⁠
⁠
.⁠
.⁠
.⁠
.⁠
.⁠
.⁠
Like, comment, and share if you found these tips helpful, and don't forget to follow us for more tips on optimising your health and wellbeing! 💤🌿 #sleep

Sunday Day means pancakes for breakfast!!⁠
⁠
Recipe: @danica.dedic⁠
⁠
Banana Oat Pancakes 🥞⁠
⁠
580 Calories - 35g protein - 19g fat - 67g carbs⁠
⁠
INGREDIENTS:⁠
- 80g Banana⁠
- 40g @uncletobys Quick Oats⁠
- 20g @vpa_australia Banana Whey Isolate⁠
- 1/4 Tsp Baking Soda⁠
- 1 x Whole Egg⁠
⁠
Toppings:⁠
- 100g @jalna_yoghurt Natural Greek Yoghurt⁠
- 30g Banana⁠
- 10g @capilanohoney Honey⁠
- 5g Bee Pollen⁠
⁠
METHOD:⁠
In a blender or food processor blitz banana, oats, whey, baking soda and egg until smooth. Heat a non stick pan over a medium heat and cook pancakes (should make 3 pancakes) flipping half way. To serve top with greek yoghurt, remaining banana, honey and bee pollen.⁠
⁠

VPA Fam, meet Bec! Bec, meet the VPA Fam! 💚⁠
⁠
Bec is our newly recruited Social Media Coordinator here at VPA! ⁠
⁠
Bec's face may look familiar and that's because she has also been a part of the VPA Fam for some time now! Last year she jumped on board as an ambassador and has been supporting the brand through our events!⁠
⁠
Bec is a seasonal Bodybuilder training under Jono at Off-Tap Fitness, a posing coach, sports nutritionist, and a full-time baddie!⁠
⁠
⁠Get to know Bec ⬇️⁠
⁠⚡️ How long have you been in the gym for? Close to 4 years now!⁠
⚡️ Favourite style of training? Hypertrophy, I just want to be a RIG⁠
⚡️ Supplements you can't live without? VPA Salted Caramel Plant Protein, Beta Alanine and anything Caffeine! (Gold Coast Stim Rainbow Candy currently has my heart!)⁠

HOW TO STAY MOTIVATED THIS WINTER 💪❄️⁠
⁠
In winter, our energy levels can take a hit as the days get shorter and colder. This disrupts our sleep and can make it tough to stay motivated. But staying active through exercise boosts our immune system, reducing the risk of winter blues and the flu. ⁠
⁠
Here are some tips to keep you motivated: ⬇️⁠
⁠
💪 Stay Active: Exercise helps boost your immune system and combat winter blues. Even a short workout can make a big difference!⁠
⁠
🌞 Get Sunlight: Catching some rays can boost your mood by triggering the release of serotonin. Aim for just 10-15 minutes a day.⁠
⁠
👯‍♂️ Find a Partner: Team up with a friend or family member to keep each other motivated and on track with your goals.⁠
⁠
📈 Track Your Progress: Celebrate your small victories and keep track of your accomplishments to stay motivated and focused on your goals.⁠
⁠
💧 Stay Hydrated: Drinking plenty of water throughout the day can help fight fatigue and keep you energised. Try the electrolyte blend if you struggle drinking water alone. ⁠
⁠
🍳 Eat a Healthy Breakfast: Fuel your day with a nutritious breakfast to boost your energy levels and support your overall well-being. Mix up some whey protein with your oats, for a filling fibrous meal.⁠
⁠
Don't let winter slow you down! Stay active, stay motivated, and crush your goals this season! 💥 ⁠
⁠
⁠

Happy mid-year! ⁠💫⁠

🍋Lemon Blueberry Protein Doughnuts🍩
🎥: @danica.dedic

Makes 6
Per Serve
 - 95 calories 
- 8g protein 
- 14g carbs
 - 2g fat

INGREDIENTS
- 30g VPA Whey Isolate
- 20g White Wings Plain Flour
- 5g Natvia Natural Sweetener
- 5g Baking Powder
- 70g Chobani Light Natural Greek Yoghurt
- 70g Three Threes Apple Sauce
- 1 x Whole Egg
- 20g Lemon Juice
- 50g Blueberries

Icing:
- 30g CSR Icing Sugar
- 10g Lemon Juice

METHOD:

Preheat oven to 180 degrees.
In a bowl, mix whey, flour, sweetener and baking powder.
In a separate bowl, mix greek yoghurt, apple sauce, egg, and lemon juice.

Combine wet and dry ingredients and mix to combine. 

Divide into 6 doughnut holes on a doughnut tray (silicone trays work best - easiest to pop out) and top with blueberries.

Bake for 10-15 minutes until cooked through.

Remove from oven and allow to cool for 5 min.

Meanwhile, mix icing sugar and lemon juice. Remove the doughnuts from the tray and dunk into the icing mixture.

Enjoy 🤌

#recipe #healthy #healthyfood #fitness

Level up with Creatine - here's why it's a game-changer:⁠
⁠
😎 Natty confirmed: ⁠
Did you know that creatine is naturally found in our bodies and obtained from foods like red meat and seafood? It is a natural energy booster!⁠
⁠
🔥 Fuel: ⁠
Creatine acts as a powerhouse for high-energy phosphate groups, in layman's terms means that it is crucial for energy production during intense workouts.⁠
⁠
💥 Strength: ⁠
Creatine helps you to increase strength, endurance, and in turn muscle building. It elevates power output and improves performance in repeated maximal-effort exercises.⁠
⁠
🏋️‍♀️ Gains: ⁠
Incorporate Creatine into your resistance training program to increase muscle hypertrophy and lean muscle gains. Lift heavier, push harder, and the gains will ROLL in! ⁠
⁠
🧠 Big Brain: ⁠
It's not just about the physical gains. Research has confirmed that creatine can offer mental perks too, enhancing cognitive function during stressful times or mental challenges.⁠
⁠
⁠

Wondering what all the hype is about with this trending product? 🔥 Studies show it's a game-changer for your fitness goals, so let's break it down! ⬇️⁠

🥦 L-Glutamine is a natural compound found in protein-rich foods and produced by your body.⁠
⁠
💡 Recent research has uncovered its incredible health benefits, from supporting gut health to aiding weight loss and boosting brain function.⁠
⁠
💥 L-Glutamine can enhance athletic performance, rev up your metabolism, speed up recovery, and even help you build muscle.⁠
⁠
💧 During intense workouts, your body's glutamine levels can drop significantly, putting your muscles at risk of being used for energy. BUT supplementing with L-Glutamine can help prevent muscle breakdown, leading to long-term GAINS.⁠
⁠
💪 Incorporating L-Glutamine into your routine can empower your muscles to push harder and recover faster, enhancing strength and muscle repair.⁠

Passionfruit Cheesecake Overnight Weetbix!⁠
⁠
📹️: @eatingforfuel ⁠
This brekkie on repeat 💛😎⁠
330 cals & 43g protein 💪🏼⁠
Plus gluten free & low in sugar!⁠
⁠
You will need:⁠
✅ 2 GF Weetbix, crushed⁠
✅ 1 scoop vanilla protein powder @vpa_australia⁠
✅ 1/3 cup milk of choice or water⁠
⁠
To top:⁠
✅ 100g vanilla protein yoghurt @chobaniau⁠
✅ Pulp from 2 passion fruits or canned pulp⁠

Method:⁠

Enjoy! 💛🤍⁠

Introducing Swolemate, the game-changing dating app for fitness buffs! 💪📱❤️‍🔥⁠
⁠
Swolemate is not your average dating app. From sharing workout routines to planning active dates, this app is all about making gains – both in the gym and in love!⁠
⁠
We understand that fitness isn't just a hobby – it's a lifestyle. And finding someone who's ready to be your partner in every rep and every mile can be tough. That's why we created this app. Whether you're into lifting, CrossFit, pilates, or running, this app is designed for those serious about fitness and looking for love!⁠
⁠
🚀 Why choose Swolemate? ⁠
Because we believe in building strong (mind the pun) connections based on shared values and goals. Say goodbye to swiping through couch potatoes and hello to finding someone who can keep up with your active lifestyle.⁠
⁠
Some of our epic features include: ⁠
⁠
🔴 Profile Goals: Show off your fitness journey, workout style, cheat meals, nutrition goals, and fave supps all in one place!⁠
⁠
🔴 Perfect Match: Our algorithm connects you with matches based on workout preferences, PBs, natural status, and even workout playlists!⁠
⁠
🔴 Gym Locator: Easily find nearby the hotspot gyms, running clubs and studios. ⁠
⁠
🔴 Time and Place: Plan workout meetups effortlessly – pick times, routines, and invite matches right from the app!⁠
⁠
🔴 Track Progress: Monitor your fitness journey, set goals, and share achievements for extra motivation – all in one app.⁠
⁠
🔴 Events and Challenges: Access group workouts, competitions, and workshops, connecting with like-minded gym buffs.⁠
⁠
⁠

🚀⛰️ ALT x VPA: Reaching New Peaks ⛰️🚀⁠
⁠
MELBOURNE, get ready for an adrenaline-packed fitness adventure!⁠
⁠
📅 Date: 6/4/24⁠
⏰ Time: 11:30-1:30pm⁠
📍 Where: Air Locker Brunswick @airlockertraining_brunswick⁠
✨ Host: @megzyy_⁠
🎟️ Tickets: LIMITED AVAILABILITY, get yours now via the link in our bio!⁠
⁠
VPA is back in Melbourne and this time, we’re reaching new peaks – quite literally! ⛰️💪⁠
⁠
Join us for ALT x VPA: Reaching New Peaks, where we’re teaming up with Air Locker Brunswick to present an epic altitude training experience.⁠
Experience an exclusive opportunity to train authentically, just like world-class athletes. ⁠
⁠
Altitude training is an unparalleled workout designed to boost performance, improve health, and elevate overall well-being. By replicating the effects of high-altitude training, this unique environment pushes your body to new limits, resulting in increased calorie burn, enhanced metabolic rate, and improved oxygen delivery to tissues, muscles, and the brain.⁠
⁠
We’re thrilled to have Megan Waters @megzyy_ from Air Locker Brunswick and Nike Trainer at @nikewellcollective as our event co-host, leading the charge in an epic workout and breath-work workshop.⁠
⁠
PLUS we are giving you guys the chance to WIN a half-year membership to Air Locker Brunswick! Simply purchase your ticket to enter the draw for this exclusive prize.🤩🤯⁠
⁠
Expect massive giveaways, gift packs of VPA’s Essentials and opportunities to mingle with fellow fitness enthusiasts, and an atmosphere charged with energy and motivation.⁠
⁠
Experience the ALT difference and unlock your new peak performance! ✨ Don’t miss out on this opportunity to take your fitness journey to new heights. ⁠
⁠
Secure your spot now! #MelbourneEvent #fitnesscommunityevents #events #community #AltitudeTraining #VPAFitness

Creamy Pistachio protein mousse! 🤍💚 ⁠
⁠
📹️: @eatingforfuel⁠
⁠
This is so simple and honestly tastes like the best creamy dessert 😍⁠
⁠
198 CALS⁠
14G PROTEIN⁠
⁠
You will need:⁠
✅ 170g protein yoghurt @yoproau⁠
✅ 20g pistachio spread @chef.joeyd⁠
✅ 25g white chocolate⁠
✅ 15g protein soy crisps⁠
✅ Optional: 1 tbsp @vpa_australia caramel white milk protein powder for an extra protein kick 😮‍💨⁠
⁠
Method:⁠
1. Mix together your protein yoghurt with the pistachio spread. Once combined, transfer into a glass jar⁠
2. Melt down your white chocolate, then mix in your protein puffs if using⁠
3. Pour the white chocolate mixture into the top of your mousse in the glass jar and refrigerate for 2-3 hours. Crack the top and enjoy!⁠
⁠
⁠

Choc Honeycomb Bark 🍫🍯⁠
⁠
📹️ Recipe by: @ninifithealthy⁠
⁠
Macros: ⁠
340 calories per serving ⁠
38g protein ⁠
⁠
Recipe gives you 2 servings ⁠
⁠
Ingredients:⁠
500g vanilla yopro yoghurt⁠
1 scoop VPA's Choc Honeycomb WPI/WPC⁠
30g Cadbury Crunchie Chocolate ⁠
25g Milk Chocolate Chips ⁠
⁠

Mix yoghurt with the choc honey comb protein powder ⁠
Add to a tray with lined baking paper ⁠
Add Crunchie and drizzle with melted chocolate ⁠
Freeze about 4 hours or till set ⁠
Enjoy 😉 ⁠

VPA X Taylah Robertson X Club SOTA

Another epic event in the books! 💥🥊 Last week’s ‘Hustle for that Muscle’ was a knockout success! 🤪

We were honoured to have special guest, Taylah Robertson, a five-time Australian Boxing Champion, share her inspiring journey with us. Her resilience and determination in a male-dominated sport left us all feeling empowered and motivated. From facing off against boys at just 10 years old to now being a month away from her shot at a world title, Taylah’s story is a testament to the power of perseverance. 🙌

Big shoutout to Club SOTA for providing us with a taste of the boxer’s training regimen! It was intense, but together, everyone knocked it out of the park. As Taylah said, ‘It’s all about who you surround yourself with,’ and our community’s support made all the difference. 💥

A huge thank you to our incredible vendors, GymBod Ice-cream, Feck Active, Say Graze, and Nibbles, for joining forces with us and making this event possible. 🔥

Stay tuned for what’s next! Our community events are only going to get bigger and better, and we can’t wait to see you there. 🤩

PROTEIN BERRY CRUMBLE 🍓 ⁠
⁠
Another delish recipe from @eatingforfuel⁠
⁠
If you love warm sweet treats, this recipe is for you! It’s easy to make and so delicious when served with cold ice cream to melt into the crumbly goodness 🤤⁠
⁠
332 CALS⁠
31G PROTEIN⁠
⁠
Berry base:⁠
✅ 120g frozen fruit blend⁠
✅ Granulated sweetener of choice @naturally_sweet_australia⁠
⁠
Crumble topping:⁠
✅ 20g GF oats @gfoats⁠
✅ 10g protein soy crisps⁠
✅ 15g vanilla protein powder @vpa_australia⁠
✅ 20ml sugar free maple syrup⁠
⁠
Topped with a serve of @twistedhealthytreats strawberries and cream ice cream 🍦⁠
⁠
Method:⁠
1. Simply combine your frozen fruit with your sweetener until mixed well. Transfer into a greased ramekin⁠
2. Now combine all of the ingredients for your crumble until it can stick together like a dough.⁠
3. Transfer the crumble over the top of the berries. Bake in the oven at 180 degrees Celsius (or air fryer) until brown on top and warm throughout the whole ramekin.⁠
4. Serve with ice cream & optional sugar free caramel syrup and enjoy!⁠
⁠

Choc Hazelnut Fudgy Brownies 🍫⁠
⁠
Repost of these iconic brownies using VPAs new choc hazelnut protein powder - @vittoriarrose 's recipe 🤩⁠
⁠
What you’ll need:⁠
🍫⁠2 eggs⁠
🍫⁠1/4 cup maple syrup⁠
🍫⁠1/2 cup peanut butter⁠
🍫⁠1 scoop of VPAs choc hazelnut protein⁠
🍫⁠3 tablespoons of cacao powder⁠
🍫⁠1 teaspoon baking powder⁠
🍫⁠1/2 cup of milk (I used oat)⁠
🍫⁠As much chocolate as you’d like⁠
⁠
Super simple:⁠
1️⃣ Add in your eggs, maple syrup and peanut butter and whisk together⁠
2️⃣ Add in your protein powder, cacao powder, baking powder and milk and combine⁠
3️⃣ If you find it’s a bit wet add in a bit of flour like I did (any will do)⁠
4️⃣ Chop up some chocolate and sprinkle on top⁠
5️⃣ Pop into the oven at 180 degrees celsius for 10-15 minutes⁠
6️⃣ Enjoy while warm!⁠

Meet our January Ambassador of the Month Kylie aka @transforming_kylie 🎉✨ ⁠
⁠
In January 2020, Kylie embarked on a transformative journey, bravely confronting the challenges of mental health, binge eating, weight gain, and depression. 💪⁠
⁠
Over the last four years, Kylie has emerged as a beacon of inspiration, shedding over 30kgs and maintaining her progress through a commitment to a well-balanced diet and lifestyle. 🌿 Her daily routine now kicks off with movement – whether it's a refreshing walk or an energising gym workout.⁠
⁠
Kylie's love for group training isn't just about the physical workout; it's the sense of community that keeps her motivated. Connecting with like-minded individuals, sharing laughter, and banter create an environment where fitness becomes fun. And when she hits the gym, a lower body burn is her ultimate favourite!⁠
⁠
Her biggest tip? Make yourself a priority. Take that walk, move for your mind, stay hydrated, and ensure you prioritise protein and fibre.🚶‍♀️💦 Kylie's mantra is all about kindness to oneself.⁠
⁠
Her mission extends beyond personal achievements; Kylie aims to inspire others that anything is achievable with hard work and consistency. She encourages everyone not to give up and emphasises that feeling good within yourself becomes a lifestyle.⁠
⁠
So shoutout to a resident recipe chef Kylie for embodying strength, resilience, and the power of self-love. 💖✨ #AmbassadorSpotlight #VPACommunityHeroes #TransformationTuesday⁠

🌟 Struggling with the 'all or nothing' approach to health? Join the club! 😅 ⁠
⁠
But fear not, here's a simple guide to building healthier habits this year:⁠
⁠
1️⃣ Start small- tiny changes lead to big wins over time. ⁠
2️⃣ Consistency over intensity.⁠
3️⃣ Make your goals enjoyable, not a chore.⁠
4️⃣ Master mindful eating - ditch crazy-fad diets.⁠
5️⃣ Prioritise mindful rest, try yoga or deep breathing.⁠
6️⃣ Track your progress for motivation.⁠
7️⃣ Find support and accountability.⁠
⁠
Here's to a happier, healthier you this 2024! ⁠

Indulge in a guilt-free delight with our Croissant French Toast recipe! 🥐✨ Packed with 28g protein, 19g fat, and 49g carbs. ⁠
⁠
Leave a like if you try this recipe by @danica.dedic out! 🌞🍓⁠
⁠
INGREDIENTS:⁠
- 1 x Woolworths All Butter Croissant⁠
- 1 x Whole Egg⁠
- 10g VPA Vanilla Whey Isolate⁠
- 50ml Skim Milk⁠
- Pinch of Cinnamon⁠
- 50g Woolworths Light Ricotta⁠
- 30g Blueberries⁠
- 50g Strawberries⁠
- 10g Pure Maple Syrup⁠
⁠
METHOD:⁠
Slice your croissant in half. ⁠
In a bowl mix together egg, whey, milk and cinnamon. ⁠
Heat a non stick pan over a medium heat. ⁠
Dunk your croissant on both sides and cook until golden.⁠
Repeat with second half. ⁠
Fill with ricotta, strawberries and blueberries. ⁠
Top with maple syrup and enjoy the yums! ⁠

TIM TAM CHEESECAKES! 🤎⁠
⁠
Recipe/vid by: @eatingforfuel⁠
320 cals and 25g protein!! #glutenfreetimtam 😮‍💨⁠
⁠
You will need:⁠
✅ 160g protein yoghurt⁠
✅ 1 egg⁠
✅ 30g VPA WPI ⁠
✅ 2 tbsp sugar free maple syrup⁠
✅ 75g light cream cheese⁠
✅ 2 gluten free Tim Tams⁠
⁠
Method:⁠
1. Preheat your oven to 180 degrees Celsius.⁠
2. In a medium mixing bowl, simply mix your yoghurt, egg, maple syrup and light cream cheese together until smooth.⁠
3. Now stir in your protein powder until free from clumps⁠
4. Chop up your Tim Tams and add the pieces to the cheesecake mixture.⁠
5. Transfer mixture into two greased ramekins and bake for 30-40 mins (or until cooked through).⁠
6. Let cool then pop in the fridge to set for at least a couple of hours. ⁠
Optional: serve with 20g melted chocolate & some Tim Tam pieces 😋⁠
⁠
Enjoy!⁠
⁠
⁠

30MIN UPPER BODY 💪⁠
⁠
📹️: bronterose.fit⁠
⁠
⁠
On a time crunch? 👀⁠
⁠
Try this upper body session ⬇️⁠

3 SETS, 8-12 REPS⁠
1A BB Push Press⁠
1B Wide Grip Lat Pulldown⁠
2B Single Arm Bench Press⁠

Another delicious recipe by @eatingforfuel⁠
⁠
Nutella & Banana Weetbix 🍫🍌 This easy & healthy brekkie option is gluten free, high in protein and perfect for us Nutella lovers 😍⁠
⁠
398 CALS⁠
26G PROTEIN⁠
⁠
You will need:⁠
✅ 2 GF Weetbix, crushed⁠
✅ 25g protein powder @vpa_australia⁠
✅ 1/2 cup almond milk⁠
⁠
Topped with:⁠
✅ 20g Nutella mixed with 7g fit vanilla yoghurt (creates the ganache)⁠
✅ 1/2 a banana⁠
⁠
You know the drill! ⁠
Mix your crushed Weetbix with your protein powder and almond milk, then flatten into a container. ⁠
Mix your Nutella and yoghurt together to create a ganache, then refrigerate overnight. ⁠
When serving, chop up your banana to add to the top and enjoy!⁠
⁠

📹️: @eatingforfuel⁠
⁠
Strawberry corn thin slice! 🍓✨ ⁠
This easy treat recipe inspired by my girl @chloeevegan is gluten free, easy to make, no-bake, high in protein and can be turned vegan by swapping one ingredient!⁠
⁠
120 CALS⁠
7G PROTEIN⁠
⁠
You will need: base⁠
✅ 6 corn things, crushed⁠
✅ 80g 70% dark chocolate (or vegan)⁠
✅ 1 tbsp protein powder @vpa_australia⁠
✅ 1 tbsp almond milk⁠
⁠
Filling:⁠
✅ 2 cups frozen strawberries mashed down with a splash of boiling water⁠
✅ 2 tbsp sugar free maple syrup⁠
✅ 1 tbsp chia seeds⁠
✅ 1 scoop vanilla protein powder⁠
⁠
Topped with:⁠
✅ An additional 80g dark chocolate of choice!⁠
⁠
Method:⁠
1. For the base, crumble up your corn thins, then melt down your dark chocolate⁠
2. Pour your dark chocolate over the corn thins and mix well to coat them. Then, mix in your protein and almond milk⁠
3. Transfer into a lined slice tray and pop in the freezer⁠
4. Make your filling by simply crushing up the frozen strawberries and combining them with the chia seeds, protein and maple syrup.⁠
5. Pour over the corn thin base and place back in the freezer⁠
6. Melt your final 80g of chocolate to pour over the slice. Spread evenly and set the slice in the freezer for at least 2-3 hours. Chop up and enjoy!⁠
⁠
⁠

Protein Mango Sorbet 🥭⁠
⁠
📹️ Recipe by: @danica.dedic⁠
⁠
MACROS for the whole tub: ⁠
280 cal⁠
30g protein ⁠
5g fat⁠
31g carbs⁠
⁠
INGREDIENTS:⁠
- 250ml So Good Unsweetened Almond Milk⁠
- 200g Frozen Mango⁠
- 30g VPA Whey⁠
- 7g Simply Delish Sugar Free Instant Pudding⁠
⁠
METHOD:⁠
Combine everything in a blender. ⁠
Blitz and put into ninja creami tub. ⁠
Freeze for 24 hr. ⁠
Pop in ninja creami on sorbet - depending on texture may need to add a bit more liquid. ⁠
Re-spin. ⁠
Enjoy x⁠
⁠
This would also be great as a smoothie if you don’t have the ninja creami :)⁠
⁠

Perfect Macro Friendly treat for the Xmas Season! 🎅🍫⁠
⁠
Vanilla PB Protein Mousse 😍🥜 Save this recipe if you love simple & sweet 4 ingredient desserts 🤤⁠
⁠
This one is gluten free and high in protein 👏🏼⁠
⁠
You will need:⁠
✅ 150g vanilla protein yoghurt⁠
✅ 1/2 scoop peanut butter protein powder⁠
✅ 2 tbsp smooth peanut butter⁠
✅ 25g white chocolate⁠
⁠
Method:⁠
1. In a small mixing bowl, combine your yoghurt and protein powder until smooth⁠
2. Transfer into a glass and top with an even layer of peanut butter. Set aside while you melt your chocolate⁠
3. Over low heat in a small saucepan, melt your chocolate until smooth⁠
4. Pour your chocolate over the peanut layer and evenly spread it out. Add some optional GF cookie crumbs and pop in the fridge to set for at least an hour. Enjoy!⁠
⁠
⁠

High Protein Caramel Cheesecake 🍰🎅⁠
⁠
Single-serve XMAS dessert sorted! 😏⁠
⁠
The beauty of this trifle/ cheesecake is that you can add your favourite toppings as layers to make it to your liking. ⁠
⁠
Directions: ⁠
⁠
Layer 1/2 of the crumbing as biscuit base- I used Carman's Oat Slice⁠
⁠
In a bowl mix up:⁠
2-3tbs High-protein yoghurt ⁠
1tbs VPA WPI in Caramel White ⁠
Dash of sugar-free maple syrup⁠
Add a layer of that mixture to the base ⁠
⁠
Then layer with your favourite toppings (I added chia seeds for some extra fibre) ⁠
Melt a tsp biscoff topping with a tsb of high protein yoghurt ⁠
Layer with the rest of the biscuit crumb ⁠
Top with fresh strawberries ⁠
⁠
Enjoy! 🎅⁠

🎉 Reflecting on an Incredible Year: 2023 in Recap! 🌟⁠
⁠
What an incredible year it's been! 2023 has truly been a year of milestones and achievements for VPA.⁠
⁠
🌟 Sponsorship Triumphs⁠
Our journey this year was sprinkled with amazing sponsorship opportunities that allowed us to connect with incredible individuals and brands. Each collaboration was a stepping stone toward greater heights, and we couldn't be more grateful for these partnerships.⁠
⁠
💪 Witnessing Huge Wins⁠
This year marked an extraordinary moment as we cheered on many of our ambassadors PLUS our very own Caity G, conquering the main stage in her inaugural bodybuilding season. ⁠

From coast to coast, we hosted 8 phenomenal fitness community events, venturing into Melbourne and Sydney for the very first time! ⁠
⁠
🍫🥜 Product Line⁠
Our product line saw new flavours and exciting additions, making this our most expansive and dynamic year yet. Each addition was crafted with the same dedication to quality and innovation that defines VPA.⁠
⁠
🙏 Gratitude⁠
To our loyal customers, friends, and partners, your unwavering support fuels our passion and commitment. Thank you for being an integral part of our journey. Your trust means everything to us.⁠
⁠
As we bid farewell to an amazing year, we eagerly look forward to the opportunities, growth, and success that 2024 will bring. ⁠

📹️: @lifeofsheridan_dietitian⁠
⁠
Looking to upgrade your breakfast?⁠
⁠
These choc, banana overnight oats have ~26g protein and 12 g of dietary fibre!⁠
⁠
INGREDIENTS⁠
✨2 small bananas⁠
✨1 1/3 cup traditional oats⁠
✨1 tbsp chia seeds⁠
✨1 1/3 cup milk of choice⁠
✨1 large scoop protein (I use @vpa_australia chocolate whey)⁠
✨3/4 cup vanilla yoghurt⁠
✨maple syrup and maple syrup to serve⁠
⁠
Perfect to hit your protein after a workout… Eating ~20-30grams of protein + carbohydrates within 60-90min of your workout is best for muscle repair & growth 💪🏼⁠
⁠
OR it’s great to increase your fibre intake (we love a healthy gut) and generally just to set yourself up for a good day!⁠
⁠
#oats #overnightoats #highprotein #protein #breakfast #workout #gym #health #workout

Raspberry Cheesecake Protein Bar⁠ 🤍⁠
By @josiesflexiblefoods⁠
⁠
ONLY 170 calories & over 11 grams of PROTEIN 🥹💕⁠
⁠
⁠
INGREDIENTS⁠
Base:⁠
8 x digestive biscuits⁠
20g Protein soy Crispies⁠
30g butter⁠
1tbs milk⁠
⁠
Filling:⁠
350g @yoproau Yogurt⁠
250g Light Cream Cheese⁠
2 x eggs⁠
100g granulated sweetener⁠
60g @vpa_australia vanilla protein powder⁠
2 tsp vanilla extract⁠
raspberries⁠
lemon zest⁠
1 tbsp lemon juice⁠
⁠
Method:⁠
- Blend base ingredients, add to a lined pan and bake at 160 degrees for 10 mins⁠
- Mix cheesecake ingredients using a whisk or electric hand mixer until just combined and no clumps remain⁠
- Add raspberries to the base and pour over filling, top with extra raspberries⁠
- Bake at 160 degrees for 30-40 mins, let cool then Refrigerate overnight⁠
- Cut into 12 slices & enjoy⁠
⁠
#snack #highprotein #highproteinrecipes #flexibleeating #flexibledieting #flexiblediet #baking #proteinbar #highproteinbaking #lowcalorie #lowcarb #lowcaloriemeals #lowcalorierecipes

Protein Oats>>> Regular Oats ⁠
⁠
Recipe by @danica.dedic⁠
⁠
MACROS:⁠
460 calories - 32g protein - 10g fat - 58g carbs⁠
⁠
- 40g @uncletobys quick oats⁠
- 175ml skim milk⁠
- 20g @vpa_australia whey protein⁠
- 3g @vpa_australia creatine⁠
- 5g @cadburyaust cocoa⁠
- 100g kiwi fruit⁠
- 50g blueberries⁠
- 10g @lindtaunz dark choc⁠
⁠
Oats + milk in a pot on the stove (I also add cinnamon). ⁠
Cook until absorbed. ⁠
Remove from heat add protein, creatine and cocoa. ⁠
Mix. Add to bowl. Top with fruit and choc. ⁠
Sprinkle with hemp seeds and cacao nibs. Boom⁠
⁠

Milo overnight weet-bix 👌⁠
Try out my new breakfast by one of our faves @sinchies⁠
⁠
INGREDIENTS:⁠
2 weet-bix⁠
60ml unsweetened almond milk (or your choice of milk)⁠
150g greek yoghurt⁠
30g chocolate protein - I use @vpa_australia⁠
10g Milo⁠
⁠
METHOD:⁠
Crunch up weet-bix⁠
Pour in milk⁠
Mix yoghurt and protein and spread on top of weet-bix.⁠
Sprinkle Milo on top.⁠
Refrigerate overnight and enjoy!⁠

Introducing our brand new Bussin Intra Tropical flavor! 🌴🍹⁠
⁠
Transport yourself to the tropical Bahamas with every sip. But it's not just about the flavour; it's also packed with powerful ingredients to boost your performance and recovery. ⁠
⁠
Here's a quick breakdown:⁠
⁠
🌟 L-Leucine: The primary amino acid responsible for muscle growth and repair, supporting those gains.⁠
⁠
💪 L-Isoleucine: Works hand in hand with L-Leucine for muscle repair and preventing muscle breakdown.⁠
⁠
🍃 L-Valine: Promotes protein synthesis and supports the nervous system and liver health.⁠
⁠
🌊 Citrulline Malate: Enhances endurance and strength by increasing nitric oxide production for better blood flow.⁠
⁠
💥 L-Glutamine: Supports muscle repair, gut health, and helps prevent muscle breakdown.⁠
⁠
🧘 Magnesium Glycinate: Aids healthy muscle cell function with superior absorption.⁠
⁠
🌿 Monopotassium Phosphate: Supports the nervous system and muscle cell health, working alongside magnesium.⁠
⁠
🌈 Vitamin B Complex: Promotes energy release and reduces bodily stress, creating an optimal environment for recovery.⁠
⁠
Experience the taste of the tropics and the benefits of these incredible ingredients in every scoop of Bussin Intra Tropical. 🏝️ Ready to take your workouts to a whole new level? Try it now!⁠

Check out this delicious recipe from Jess from @eatingforfuel ⁠
⁠
Healthier, high protein peanut butter cups 🫶🏼🫢🍫🥜🤝🏻 These are GF, lower in sugar and packed with a cheeky extra crunch!⁠
⁠
You will need:⁠
✅ 200g chocolate of choice @vitawerx⁠
✅ 1/2 scoop chocolate protein powder of choice. I used choc peanut butter cup by @vpa_australia⁠
✅ 5 tbsp smooth natural peanut butter @picspeanutbutter⁠
✅ 1 cup GF Rice Bubbles⁠
⁠
Method:⁠
1. Line a cupcake tray with 6-8 cupcake cases and set aside (depends on tray size, will make 6 large)⁠
2. Melt your chocolate over low heat until smooth and free from lumps. Now mix in your protein powder until smooth, then your Rice Bubbles. Stir well⁠
3. Pour a dollop of the chocolate mixture into the base of each cupcake wrapper to create the bottom of the cups⁠
4. Add peanut butter evenly to the middle of each cup⁠
5. Cover with the remaining chocolate mix and shake the tray gently to even out the chocolate⁠
6. Refrigerate for 1-2 hours and enjoy!⁠
⁠
⁠

Caramilk Protein Cheesecakes 🍰⁠
⁠
Recipe by: @danica.dedic⁠
⁠
⁠
Makes 4 serves⁠
Macros per serve: ⁠
245 calories - 21g protein - 11g fat - 17g carbs��⁠
⁠
INGREDIENTS:⁠
- 3 x McVities Digestive Biscuits⁠
- 20g Flora ProActiv, Melted⁠
- 200g Chobani Light Greek Yoghurt⁠
- 100g Philadelphia Light Cooking Cream Cheese⁠
- 60g VPA Caramel White Milk Whey Isolate⁠
- 3g Gelatine Powder⁠
- 30g Boiling Water⁠
- 25g Caramilk Chocolate⁠
⁠
METHOD:⁠
1. In a food processor or blender, blitz your biscuits until they become a fine crumb. Add in melted flora proactiv and mix until combined. Divide into 4 muffin holes in a silicone muffin tin (NOTE: It has to be silicone so that you can easily pop out the cheesecakes once set). Refrigerate.⁠
⁠
2. To make the filling, mix together Greek yogurt, cream cheese, and protein powder. In a small bowl, combine the gelatine powder with boiling water and mix until dissolved. Once dissolved, add to the cheesecake mixture and mix until well combined. Divide the mixture between muffin holes on top of the biscuit base. Refrigerate overnight. ⁠
⁠
Once set, pop cheesecakes out of molds. Drizzle over melted caramilk and enjoy x⁠
⁠
⁠

⁠

INGREDIENTS⁠

White Caramel Raspberry Slices 🍮🍓🍰⁠
⁠
Another banging recipe by our resident VPA chef 🧑‍🍳: @vittoriarrose⁠
⁠
⁠
Ingredients:⁠
- 120g melted butter⁠
- 1/2 cup of brown sugar⁠
- Dash of salt⁠
- 2 eggs⁠
- 1 tsp vanilla extract⁠
- 2 scoops of VPAs WPI in (white caramel milk)⁠
- 1 cup of flour⁠
- White chocolate (measure with the heart)⁠
- Raspberries (frozen or fresh)⁠
⁠
Method:⁠
1. Preheat oven to 180c⁠
2. Mix together the melted butter and sugar⁠
3. Whisk in eggs and vanilla extract⁠
4. Add in your protein, flour and salt and combine⁠
5. Add in the white chocolate and raspberries and mix until just combined⁠
6. Line your baking tray with butter and baking paper⁠
7. Cook for 20-30 min in the oven⁠
8. Let cool and enjoy!⁠
⁠
⁠

Choc Peanut Butter Overnight Weetbix 🥜🍫❤️
It’s like having dessert for breakfast, so delicious 

You’ll need ( per serving ) : 
• 2 Weetbix 
• 60-80ml Milk (your preferred milk) 
• 120g High Protein Yoghurt 
• 1 1/2 scoops of @vpa_australia chocolate hazelnut protein powder 
• 1 serving @macr0mike powdered peanut butter
• 20g @twistedhealthytreats hard shell chocolate topping

Method
1. Crush Weetbix in the bottom of the container. Mix in milk and flatten down. 
2. Mix yoghurt and protein powder together in a bowl. Add on top of Weetbix and make smooth. 
3. Prepare powdered peanut butter. Add on top of the yoghurt mixture. 
4. Drizzle chocolate topping on top. 
5. Store in the fridge overnight and eat the next morning 😋

Calories: 481
Protein: 61g
Carbs: 33g
Fats: 12g

Here's how you create this Quick and Delicious Caramel White Overnight Weetbix! 🤩⁠
⁠
🌾 Crumble 2 Weetbix into your chosen container.⁠
⁠
🍁 Drizzle 1-2 tablespoons of sugar-free maple syrup over the Weetbix crumble.⁠
⁠
🥛 Pour 1/3 cup of almond milk over the mixture, then flatten it with a spoon to create a flat base.⁠
⁠
🥄 Add 100-120 grams of creamy vanilla Greek yogurt to enhance both the texture and protein content.⁠
⁠
🥤 Mix in 1/2 - 1 scoop of our VPA WPI in Caramel White Milk, depending on your protein preference. This protein powder infuses your breakfast with a rich, irresistible caramel flavour.⁠
⁠
🍫 For an extra layer of indulgence, melt a few pieces of Caramilk chocolate and drizzle them over your creation. The combination of Caramilk and our Caramel White Milk WPI is a match made in breakfast heaven.⁠
⁠
🌙 Place your container in the fridge and let it work its magic overnight.⁠
⁠
⁠
Try this tonight so tomorrow's brekky is sorted 😏⁠

𝐂𝐨𝐟𝐟𝐞𝐞 𝐁𝐢𝐬𝐜𝐮𝐢𝐭 + 𝐁𝐞𝐫𝐫𝐲 𝐎𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐧𝐢𝐠𝐡𝐭 𝐖𝐞𝐞𝐭𝐬 ☕️🍓🫐⁠
⁠
📹️: Most delish recipe from @courtney.farrell_⁠
⁠
Overnight Weetbix is such a quick and easy brekky to make the night before. Anything to save this girl time in the mornings is essential. 𝐍𝐨𝐭 𝐭𝐨 𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧- this literally tastes like you’re eating dessert!⁠
⁠
Ingredients⁠
• 2 x weetbix, crushed⁠
• 120ml milk of choice⁠
• 15g iced coffee protein powder, @vpa_australia⁠
• 160g yoghurt, I used mixed berry YoPro⁠
⁠
Toppings⁠
• 10g nutrigrain⁠
• 65g mixed berries⁠
• 1/2 scotch finger 50% less sugar⁠
⁠
Crush weetbix into a bowl (I do so roughly as I prefer the texture). Then combine your milk and protein powder before adding to the weetbix. Mix and smooth over for the base. Spread your yoghurt before laying with your toppings. Refrigerate for an hour or overnight. Enjoy! 🫶🏼⁠
⁠
Save this post next time you need brekky on the go. 🍓🏃‍♀️⁠

🍯 Caramilk Crispy Bites Recipe 🍫⁠
⁠
Ingredients:⁠
⁠
⚪️2 Scoops of VPA WPI Caramel White Protein⁠
⚪️10-15ml of sugar-free maple syrup⁠
⚪️110 grams of Rice Bubbles⁠
⚪️Caramilk chocolate for melting⁠
⁠
Instructions:⁠
⁠
🍯In a mixing bowl, combine 2 scoops of VPA WPI Caramel White Protein with 10-15ml of sugar-free maple syrup.⁠
🍫Add 110 grams of Rice Bubbles to the mixture and stir until well combined.⁠
🍯Flatten the mixture evenly into a baking dish.⁠
🍫Melt some Caramilk chocolate and drizzle it over the top.⁠
🍯Refrigerate for approximately 3 hours or until firm.⁠
🍫Once set, cut into bite-sized pieces and enjoy your delicious Caramilk Crispy Bites! 🍫😋 #CrispyBites #CaramelWhiteDelight⁠

The weekend is here, and it's time to relax and enjoy a refreshing Bussin Mocktail! 🍓🍉🍸️⁠

This delicious and alcohol-free drink is made with fresh fruit and VPA Bussin BCAA in Berry Melon. It's the perfect way to cool off on a hot day or to enjoy after a long workout.⁠

Here's how to make it:⁠

Enjoy!🤌😋⁠

This mocktail is so refreshing and thirst-quenching and low in cals, so perfect for those in a deficit! Plus, the added BCAAs will help you recover from your workout and keep you feeling energised all day long.⁠

So what are you waiting for? Make a Bussin Mocktail today!⁠

Looking to take your fitness and health to the next level? 😏⁠
⁠
Stack up your aminos! Amino acids are the building blocks of protein, and they're essential for muscle growth, repair, and recovery. 💪⁠
⁠
There are three amino acids that are particularly important for athletes and fitness enthusiasts: GABA, L-glutamine, and L-carnitine.⁠
⁠
1️⃣ GABA is a calming amino acid that can help reduce stress and anxiety. It can also help improve sleep quality and boost athletic performance.⁠
⁠
2️⃣ L-glutamine is an essential amino acid that helps support muscle growth and repair. It can also help boost the immune system and reduce muscle soreness.⁠
⁠
3️⃣ L-carnitine is an amino acid that helps shuttle fat into the mitochondria, where it can be burned for energy. It can also help improve endurance and performance.⁠
⁠
⁠
⁠

🌟 R U OK❓️ 🌟⁠
⁠
In a world that never seems to slow down, it's easy to forget the incredible power of a simple question: "Are you okay?" 💬⁠
⁠
Today, we encourage you to reach out to a buddy and simply ask how they've been doing. ⁠
⁠
This a reminder that mental health is just as crucial as our physical well-being, and here are some simple ways to recharge if you've been feeling a bit down: ⁠
⁠
1️⃣ Move Your Body: Physical activity is a fantastic mood booster. Even a short walk or a quick workout session, just get that body moving 💪🏋️‍♀️⁠
⁠
2️⃣ Nutrient-Rich Diet: Proper nutrition fuels not just your body but your mind too. Make sure you're getting a balanced intake of protein, vitamins, and minerals. 🥛⁠
⁠
3️⃣ Mindfulness Meditation: Taking a few minutes each day to meditate can help clear your mind and reduce stress.🧘⁠
⁠
4️⃣ Quality Sleep: Make sure you're getting enough rest. Sleep is when your body and mind recover and rejuvenate. 💤⁠
⁠
5️⃣ Connect with Friends: Social support is vital for mental well-being. So reach out to some friends or family for a chat on how they've been doing. 👬👭⁠
⁠
⁠
⁠
⁠
⁠
⁠
⁠

Dear Mums, Dads and other concerned guardians, ⁠
⁠
I know you're worried about your little gym rat. You see them taking all these supplements and you're not sure what they're doing to their bodies. You're afraid they're going to turn into hulking, muscle-bound freaks.🐺⁠
⁠
We get it. But VPA is here to tell you that creatine is not steroids. 🚫⁠
⁠
It's a natural substance that's found in your body and in food, such as meat and fish. It basically acts as an aid to your muscles produce energy, so you can work out harder and longer.⁠
⁠
So rest easy, creatine is safe and effective. 💯⁠
It's been studied extensively and there's no evidence that it causes any harmful side effects. 🧬⁠
⁠
So next time you see your little gym rat taking creatine, don't worry. Just smile and know that they're doing what they need to do to reach their fitness goals. 🤩⁠
⁠
Warm regards, ⁠
⁠
VPA💚⁠

"What's the difference between your two pre-workouts?"⁠
⁠
VPA offers two incredible Pre-Workout options: ⁠
Venom and Gold Coast stim⁠
⁠
Finding the perfect pre-workout to suit you and your training style can be overwhelming. That's why we are here to help. 🤩⁠
⁠
Here's the breakdown ⚡️⁠
⁠
With GC Stim, you will experience amplified energy, laser focus, and increased cognitive performance to push yourself to the next level of your training, beyond your previous limits 🦸⁠
⁠
You will feel the powerful and explosive muscular performance created by the efficient nutrient delivery pathways, generating blood flow to the working muscles to offer fuller pumps and a well-formed muscular shape. ⁠
⁠

⚡️ LET'S COMPARE THE PAIR ⚡️⁠
⁠
The number one question surrounding protein powders is "Which one should I take? Whey Protein Concentrate or Whey Protein Isolate?". ⁠
⁠
Here's the scoop: Whey Protein Isolate is your ultimate lean muscle partner. It's carefully processed to remove excess carbs and fats, delivering high protein content per serving. Ideal for those aiming for sculpted gains without the extras. 💪💯⁠
⁠
On the other side of the shaker, Whey Protein Concentrate offers a balanced blend. It maintains more of whey's natural goodness, with a slightly higher carb and fat content, making it a great choice for all-around recovery. 🔄💚⁠
⁠
So, whether you're pushing limits at the gym or need a reliable recovery boost, your choice of whey matters. Isolate for that precision sculpting, or Concentrate for an all-in-one replenishment. 🔥🌟 Remember, it's about YOUR fitness journey, and the gains are yours to make. Cheers to protein power! 💪🥤 #WheyWisdom #ChooseYourFuel #GymFuel"

Triple Choc Mousse Cheesecake Cup 😍🍫⁠
⁠
Here's How ⬇️⁠
⁠
Ingredients: ⁠
🍫10 Grams of VPA Choc Caramel Protein Ball Mix⁠
🍫25 Grams of VPA Chocolate Mousse Protein Powder⁠
🍫5 Grams of Nutella⁠
⁠
Directions:⁠
1️⃣ Mix together VPA Choc Caramel Protein Ball Mix with 3ml of water. ⁠
2️⃣ Add Protein Ball mix to a muffin tray in a muffin liner. Press down to compact. ⁠
3️⃣ Mix 25 grams of VPA Protein Mousse Protein Powder with 40ml of Water. Mix vigorously for 60-90 seconds. ⁠
4️⃣ Add Protein Mousse on top of the Protein Ball mix in the muffin tray.⁠
5️⃣ Freeze for 2 hours. ⁠
6️⃣ Add Nutella while Mousse Cheesecake Cup is still frozen.⁠
7️⃣ Place in fridge to thaw for 1 hour.⁠
8️⃣ Enjoy!⁠
⁠
Macros: ⁠
178 Calories⁠
21.2g Protein⁠
8.4g Carbs⁠
6.3g Fats ⁠
⁠

Choc Hazelnut Fudgy Brownies 🍫⁠
⁠
Let’s make some brownies using VPAs new choc hazelnut protein powder - @vittoriarrose 's recipe 🤩⁠
⁠
What you’ll need:⁠
 🍫⁠2 eggs⁠
 🍫⁠1/4 cup maple syrup⁠
 🍫⁠1/2 cup peanut butter⁠
 🍫⁠1 scoop of VPAs choc hazelnut protein⁠
 🍫⁠3 tablespoons of cacao powder⁠
 🍫⁠1 teaspoon baking powder⁠
 🍫⁠1/2 cup of milk (I used oat)⁠
 🍫⁠As much chocolate as you’d like⁠
⁠
Super simple:⁠
1️⃣ Add in your eggs, maple syrup and peanut butter and whisk together⁠
2️⃣ Add in your protein powder, cacao powder, baking powder and milk and combine⁠
3️⃣ If you find it’s a bit wet add in a bit of flour like I did (any will do)⁠
4️⃣ Chop up some chocolate and sprinkle on top⁠
5️⃣ Pop into the oven at 180 degrees celsius for 10-15 minutes⁠
6️⃣ Enjoy while warm!⁠
⁠
⁠

Sundays are for meal prep! Give this delicious brekky a go this week 😍⁠
⁠
Recipe ⬇️⁠
⁠
INGREDIENTS:⁠
💗Jelly Crystals⁠
💗Greek yogurt⁠
💗3 Weetbix⁠
💗Milk of choice⁠
💗Vanilla VPA WPI⁠
⁠
METHOD:⁠
1️⃣ Make the Jelly as per packet instructions.⁠
2️⃣ Break up Weetbix. Add milk of choice until just visible. Pat down.⁠
3️⃣ Add Yoghurt of choice + 1 scoop of your protein and mix until thick.⁠
4️⃣ Add to the top of Weetbix. Set in fridge/ freezer to set.⁠
5️⃣ Once firm, add jelly. Place in fridge until set.⁠
⁠
Enjoy!⁠
⁠

Cluster Dextrin! What is it and why should you add it to your supp stack?⁠ 🔥
⁠
Cluster Dextrin is a carbohydrate known for its ability to rapidly and efficiently provide energy to the body during physical activity without causing a sudden spike in blood sugar levels. This is because it is easily digested and absorbed by the body, which helps to sustain energy levels during prolonged exercise.⁠
⁠
Benefits of Cluster Dextrin:⁠
⚡️ Increased Endurance⁠
⚡️ Improved Performance⁠
⚡️ Faster recovery times after exercise. It is also a popular supplement. ⁠
⁠

COLLAGEN! 💜 What is it and why should you add it to your supplement stack? ⁠
⁠
Collagen Hydrolysate is a unique combination of amino acids that can promote healing and conditioning over other proteins. Collagen Hydrolysate offers numerous benefits for joints, bones, tendons, ligaments, cartilage, skin, hair, and nails. Collagen also supports blood vessels and organs such as the heart, kidneys, and liver.⁠
⁠
The Probiotic, Bacillus coagulans strain, helps to improve gut health, joint health, and nutrient absorption and reduces inflammation. It helps prevent the growth of bad bacteria (pathogenic microbes) and allows good bacteria (B. coagulans) to dominate the gut flora. ⁠
⁠
The addition of prebiotic fibre (Inulin) helps to nourish the healthy bacteria in your gut to support probiotic function.⁠
⁠

One week since @retail_global! 🔥⁠
⁠
For the past week, we have been reflecting and gathering our notes from Retail Global and my gosh where do we start!⁠
⁠
We have been inspired by all of the other businesses who attended and we are so excited to implement new strategies into our brand to make VPA even better! ⁠
⁠
A special mention to Owner and Director, Sven Ray who delivered a Seminar on the 5 Reports every E-Comm business should have... If you missed it here they are...⁠
⁠
1️⃣ Fins – PL, BS, Cash flows – the numbers don’t lie!⁠
2️⃣ Social Media/Marketing – where is your marketing money going each month and for what ROI?⁠
3️⃣ Inventory turnover report [medium only] – stock must move!⁠
4️⃣ R&D and Business development report – your job as owner is to ensure pipeline for years to come!⁠
5️⃣ Cash flow forecast - cash is king!⁠
⁠
Until next year...

LADIES! Have you put off adding Creatine to your supplement stack because you don't want to look 'bulky'? 💪🙎‍♀️⁠
⁠
There is a stigma surrounding Creatine and that it is only a supplement that you take if you want to gain some serious muscle and strength 💪 You may have also heard that creatine causes water retention and weight gain.⁠
⁠
Whilst some of this is partially true, only a portion of the picture has been painted. ⁠
⁠
Creatine is one of the most researched supplements in the marketplace and is a naturally occurring molecule within our bodies.⁠
⁠
Creatine increases the rate at which energy can be produced and used within our body. It helps you work harder and work longer by helping to replenish your energy systems. This increases peak power output, and this in turn has and this has several positive impacts on sports performance and body composition. For Women, this can mean gaining lean muscle mass (which may see the scales rise as muscle weighs more than fat). ⁠
⁠
⁠To shop, visit the link in our bio. 🛒⁠

Let's make the Ultimate Breakfast, Weetbix Jelly Slice with Ambassador, @lifeofsheridan_dietitian 😍⁠
⁠
INGREDIENTS:⁠
💗Jelly Crystals⁠
💗Greek yogurt⁠
💗3 Weetbix⁠
💗Milk of choice⁠
💗Vanilla WPI⁠
⁠
METHOD:⁠
1️⃣ Make the Jelly as per packet instructions.⁠
2️⃣ Break up Weetbix. Add milk of choice until just visible. Pat down.⁠
3️⃣ Add Yoghurt of choice + 1 scoop of your protein and mix until thick.⁠
4️⃣ Add to the top of Weetbix. Set in fridge/ freezer to set.⁠
5️⃣ Once firm, add jelly. Place in fridge until set.⁠
⁠
Enjoy!⁠
⁠
Make sure to give @@lifeofsheridan_dietitian 😍 for more delicious recipes!⁠

LADIES! Have you put off adding Creatine to your supplement stack because you don't want to look 'bulky'? 💪🙎‍♀️⁠
⁠
There is a stigma surrounding Creatine and that it is only a supplement that you take if you want to gain some serious muscle and strength 💪 You may have also heard that creatine causes water retention and weight gain.⁠
⁠
Whilst some of this is partially true, only a portion of the picture has been painted. ⁠
⁠
Creatine is one of the most researched supplements in the marketplace and is a naturally occurring molecule within our bodies.⁠
⁠
Creatine increases the rate at which energy can be produced and used within our body. It helps you work harder and work longer by helping to replenish your energy systems. This increases peak power output, and this in turn has and this has several positive impacts on sports performance and body composition. For Women, this can mean gaining lean muscle mass (which may see the scales rise as muscle weighs more than fat). ⁠
⁠
Overall, Creatine is a great supplement to add to your stack and isn't just for men! Get yours today for FREE when you spend a minimum of $80 🤑 No code is needed. ⁠
⁠
⁠To shop, visit the link in our bio. 🛒⁠

HEY THERE! Looking for tips to improve your training this new season? 💪⁠
⁠
We gotcha! Follow these 3 easy steps for an improved training program:⁠
⁠
🔥 Step 1: Train Unilaterally. Start incorporating exercises like one-legged squats, split squats, and lunges. Your backbones and body muscles will surely love it!⁠
⁠
🔥 Step 2: Organize Your Program in 4 to 12 Week Blocks. Having your training program written out helps you stay disciplined. Stick to a plan, and you can adjust according to daily rest, stress, and other variables.⁠
⁠
🔥 Step 3: Add Amino Acids During Your Workouts. We tear microscopic fibers in the muscle during a workout. Amino acids aid in the repair process and provide training energy.

WPI and WPC, what's the difference? ⁠
⁠
Choose WPC if you’re after a cheaper, slower-digesting protein that contains lots of macronutrients and bioactive compounds. WPC is a great option to consume throughout the day 💪⁠
⁠
Choose WPI if you’re after pure whey protein powder with lower levels of fat, carbohydrate, and lactose that contains fewer calories than WPC. WPI is ideal for people who want to get fast-digesting protein into their body after a workout or want to restrict the number of calories they consume 🔥

😍 BISCOFF PROTEIN CHEESECAKES 😍⁠
⁠
The goodness of biscoff and premium protein powder in cheesecake form, it can't get any better than this! This luscious Biscoff Protein Cheesecake recipe is perfect for any occasion, may it be birthdays or days where you feel like treating yourself. Made with VPA's WPI protein powder. 🔥⁠
⁠
NUTRITION:⁠
Calories 277, Protein 22 grams, Fat 12 grams, Carbs 20 grams⁠
⁠
INGREDIENTS:⁠
⁠
3 x McVities Digestive Biscuits⁠
20g Devondale 25% Less Fat Butter, Melted⁠
200g Chobani 0.5% Fat Greek Yoghurt⁠
100g Philadelphia 60% Less Fat Cooking Cream Cheese⁠
60g VPA Vanilla Whey Isolate⁠
20g Biscoff Smooth Spread⁠
3g Gelatine Powder⁠
30g Boiling Water⁠
2 x Biscoff Biscuits⁠
10g Biscoff Smooth Spread⁠
⁠
DIRECTIONS⁠
😍 1. In a food processor or blender, blitz your biscuits until they become fine crumbs. Add in melted butter and mix until combined.⁠
😍 2. Weigh your total base mixture and divide by 4, this will give you the total grams of biscuit base per cheesecake. Evenly distribute into 4 muffin holes in a silicone muffin tin (NOTE: It has to be silicone so that you can easily pop out the cheesecakes once set). Refrigerate.😍3. To make the filling, mix together greek yogurt, cream cheese, and protein powder. In a small bowl, combine the gelatine powder with boiling water and mix until dissolved. Once dissolved, add to the cheesecake mixture and mix until well combined.⁠
😍 4. Melt Biscoff spread and add to cheesecake mixture and mix until well combined.⁠
😍5. Weigh your total cheesecake mixture and divide by 4, this will give you the total grams per cheesecake. Distribute the mixture into muffin holes on top of the base. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours (overnight preferred). Once set, pop cheesecakes out of molds. Drizzle over melted Biscoff spread and crush Biscoff biscuits. Serve and enjoy.⁠
⁠

Here is a perfectly fluffy Easy Recipe Vegan Chocolate Mug Cake made with VPA's vegan Premium Plant protein. In less than 5 minutes you could be tucked up on the couch enjoying a tasty dessert with no hidden nasties. 🍫🍰⁠
⁠
INGREDIENTS⁠
1 scoop VPA Chocolate Premium Plant⁠
2 tbsp Coconut Sugar⁠
½ tsp Baking Powder⁠
2 tbsp Cocoa Powder⁠
1 tbsp Coconut Flour⁠
1 Flax Egg*⁠
¼ cup Milk (Coconut or Almond)⁠
1 tbsp White Chocolate Chips (Vegan)⁠
DIRECTIONS⁠
Set the choc chips to the side.⁠
In a small mixing bowl, combine all ingredients until smooth.⁠
Transfer to a large microwave-safe mug.⁠
To with the choc chips.⁠
Microwave for approx. 1 minute. **⁠
⁠
Enjoy your Chocolate mug Cake.⁠

This vegan banana bread is fluffy, moist & perfectly infused with sweet banana & caramel flavour. Made oil-free they are a healthy addition to any lunchbox or pre/post workout munchies. These mini loaves have loads of character & are packed with 22g of protein per serve! ⁠
⁠
Made with VPA Salted Caramel Premium Plant Protein⁠
⁠
Nutritional info:⁠
Calories - 388 per serve⁠
Fat - 15.4g⁠
Carbs - 38.8g⁠
Protein - 22.7g⁠
⁠
Details below 👇🏼 ⁠
Bread:⁠
1.5 cups wholemeal spelt flour ⁠
1/2 cup VPA salted caramel Premium Plant Protein ⁠
1 tsp cinnamon⁠
1 tsp nutmeg⁠
1.5 tsp baking powder⁠
1/2 pink salt⁠
⁠
Wet ingredients:⁠
3 ripe bananas⁠
1/2 cup dairy-free yoghurt ⁠
1/3 cup sugar free maple syrup⁠
1 tsp vanilla essence⁠
1 flax egg (1 tbs ground flax + 3 tbs water)⁠
1 tbs nut butter (I used almond)⁠
⁠
Frosting:⁠
1/2 dairy-free yoghurt⁠
1/4 cup VPA salted caramel Premium Plant Protein ⁠
1 tbs nut butter ⁠
⁠
Method:⁠
1. Preheat oven 180D.⁠
2. Make flax egg (1 tbs ground flax + 3 tbs water) & set aside (leave for 10mins).⁠
3. Add wet ingredients + flax egg to a large bowl & stir until combined well. ⁠
4. Add dry ingredients & combine well.⁠
5 Add to moulds or loaf tin.⁠
6 Bake for 30-40mins until golden or toothpick comes out clean.⁠
7. Allow to cool for 5mins before removing from moulds or tin.⁠
8. Combine ingredients for the frosting adding a little bit of water if needed. Add the frosting once the bread has cooled completely.⁠
9. Enjoy! 😋⁠
⁠

Banana Bread Protein Muffins 🍌🍫⁠
180 cal - 7.5g protein -23g carbs - 6g fat - per muffin⁠

The perfect on the go brekkie or snack⁠

Makes 12 muffins 🧁⁠

INGREDIENTS:⁠
- 215g @uncletobys quick oats⁠
- 30g @vpa_australia vanilla whey protein⁠
- 10g baking powder⁠
- 3g @masterfoods cinnamon⁠
- Pinch of salt⁠
- 75g @queenfinefoods 100% pure maple syrup⁠
- 250ml skim milk⁠
- 95g banana, mashed⁠
- 60g @begapeanutbutter simply nuts smooth peanut butter⁠
- 1 x whole egg⁠
- 60g @cadburyaust dark chocolate baking chips⁠
⁠
METHOD:⁠
1. Preheat oven to 180 degrees and line a muffin tin with cupcake cases.⁠
2. Combine all ingredients in a bowl and mix until combine.⁠
3. Distribute evenly between cupcake cases. Bake for 20 minutes or until a skewer inserted comes our clean⁠

This easy protein waffle recipe with crushed Oreo™ cookies makes a delicious sweet breakfast or a great post-workout snack 😍⁠
⁠
Now this isn't a low carbohydrate, low calorie recipe, which makes these waffles exactly what you need to kick-start your recovery after a hard morning training session 🔥💪⁠
⁠
Directions: ⁠
1. In a food processor or blender, blitz 20g oats until they become a fine powder. It should be a flour-like consistency. ⁠
⁠
2. In a bowl, combine oats, 100g of mashed banana, 1 whole egg and protein powder. Mix until combined. Crush one 1 into the mixture and mix until evenly distributed throughout the mixture. ⁠
⁠
3.Heat up your waffle machine. Once hot, pour in mixture and close. Allow to cook for 5 minutes or until golden. ⁠
⁠
4. Once the waffle is cooked, remove from the waffle maker and put on a serving plate. Dust with icing sugar, top with 50g coconut yoghurt, and crush 1 oreo over the top. Drizzle with chocolate topping and serve! 😁⁠
⁠
Author:⁠
@danica.dedic⁠

Lets Bake! 😍⁠
⁠
Try this Banana and Raspberry Baked Oats!⁠
⁠
What you will need: ⁠
Ingredients Base:⁠
- 30g Whey Protein Isolate in Vanilla ⁠
- 45g Rolled Oats⁠
- 100g Banana⁠
- 20g Raspberries⁠
 - 1/2 tsp Baking Powder⁠
Ingredients Topping:⁠
- 30g Anchor protein plain Greek yoghurt⁠
- 6g Fix and Fogg coffee maple⁠
- Peanut butter⁠
- 2g toasted flaked almonds⁠
⁠
Directions:⁠
1. Blend everything expected for raspberries and 1/4 of the banana in a blender and pour half the mixture into a greased oven proof dish then sprinkle in raspberries and pour oven remaining mixture.⁠
2. Top with slices of the last bit of banana and put in the oven at 180 for 30 mins.⁠
3. Served with yoghurt, peanut butter, toasted almonds and some extra raspberries - ENJOY and don't forget to tag us when you recreate! 😍

Easter is just around the corner! Check out this MINI EGG MILLIONAIRE’S SHORTBREAD SLICE by VPA Ambassador Rose @dietitianrose 🐰⁠
⁠
WHAT YOU’LL NEED:⁠
Base:⁠
1 cup or 100g oat flour⁠
1 heaped scoop (35g) protein powder (I used @vpa_australia vanilla plant)⁠
4 tbsp or 40mL maple syrup⁠
3 tbsp or 30mL macadamia oil⁠
1 tsp 3g vanilla extract⁠
⁠
Middle:⁠
100g peanut butter (I used @mayversfood smooth variety)⁠
40ml maple syrup⁠
⁠
Top:⁠
~100g chocolate of choice, melted⁠
@cadburyaust mini eggs (crushed & whole)⁠
⁠
METHOD:⁠
1. In a small bowl combine the base ingredients until a dough-like consistency forms. Transfer mixture into a rectangular small baking dish (~9cmx5cm) and press down firmly. Set aside.⁠
⁠
2. Meanwhile prepare the filling by combining the above filling ingredients in a small bowl. Once smooth in consistency (& thickened), using a spatula, spread the middle layer out evenly on top of the base.⁠
⁠
3. Finally, melt the chocolate in a microwave safe bowl for ~1.5-2 minutes, or until melted (stopping every 30 seconds to stir to prevent chocolate from burning). Pour chocolate over the middle layer, and using the back of a spoon evenly distributed.⁠
⁠
4. To finish, place a few mini eggs on top, including some crushed ones.⁠
⁠
5. Freeze for ~2 hours or until set. Cut into desired bar/ square pieces (tip here: ensure the middle layer of the slice is set/ slightly frozen first before attempting to cut - if there is any “ooze” of the peanut butter layer, it’s not ready). Also ensure that you use a sharp knife! AND if you forget about it in the freezer like I did, don’t sweat it! Just allow it to thaw for ~5-10 minutes before cutting 😊⁠

Wise words from our VPA Ambassador of the month, @dietitianrose 👇🏻⁠
⁠
"Although it may seem like a simple concept, you’d be surprised how actually eating enough and eating more consistently can have such an impact.⁠
⁠
There could be a bunch of reasons as to why you may find yourself over-eating. But, this is one of the more common ones that we see in clinics. In many situations, you’re not eating enough/ not eating inconsistently (either intentionally, aka severe restriction due to body image concerns, disordered eating/ an eating disorder, etc or un-intentionally).⁠
⁠
However, eating minimal throughout the day, in attempt to control your caloric intake or in fear of “overdoing it” or “binging” when the opportunity arises to eat, is not the answer to solve your cravings and hence binge eating behaviours. Particularly done by those who feel guilty with their food choices and tend to couple this with copious amounts of training as way to compensate for the influx of extra calories.⁠
⁠
Most often than not, this will result in the complete opposite, where binge-eating behaviours can occur, especially the later half of the day, if the first half has been severely restricted (aka the “binge restrict cycle”).⁠
⁠
The solution is not to be more “strict”, have more “self control”, eat less through out the day (aka time restricted eating), or chose the lowest calorie food options to control your caloric intake, but instead, giving yourself permission to actually eat. Eating whole, nutrient dense foods to provide your body with the energy it needs to thrive & perform. And most importantly, ditching the all or nothing “diet” mentality with nutrition. No goods are off limits or “good” versus “bad”, you can enjoy those foods, often demonised by diet culture, such as chocolate/ ice-cream/[insert food here], and still be “healthy”. Everything has its extremities - just remember the dose is the poisons. No diet is perfect!⁠
⁠
Let’s shift this focus to fuelling yourself adequately to perform: for life in general as well as training 💪🏼"
Put your hands up if you can relate! 🙋🏻‍♂️ 🤪

Happy World Nutella Day! ⁠
⁠
For a protein-packed snack, check out this easy and delicious Nutella Rice Pudding recipe 👇🏼⁠
⁠
Ingredients:⁠
✔️ 1 cup Boiled Rice⁠
✔️ 1 scoop VPA Whey Protein Isolate in Chocolate ⁠
 ✔️ 1 tbsp Nutella⁠
⁠
Directions:⁠
1. In a mixing bowl, combine all ingredients until the protein powder is dissolved.⁠
2. Chill for 4 hours and serve with strawberries on top.⁠
3. Enjoy and prepare for your workout!

Everyone’s health and safety are our top priority here at VPA. Currently, it is vital to limit social contact to stop the spread of COVID-19 to keep the community ⁠safe. For this reason, we have made the difficult decision to postpone our “New Year, New You” event to a later date. Whilst we know this is disappointing, we hope that you can understand the steps we’re taking to help keep our staff and attendees safe.⁠
⁠
In despite of our best efforts to host this event next Saturday (15 January 2022) it has been brought to our attention by Queensland health that having a ⁠conference at this time of the year is not advised due to the rapid spread of the Omicron variant. ⁠
⁠
Unfortunately, this is completely out of our control and that if we were to go ahead with the said event the reinstated mask requirements as well as the social ⁠distancing requirements would hinder the delivery of our event immensely. We want this event to be an experience for all who attend, we feel this isn’t possible ⁠with the current restrictions set in place. ⁠
⁠
VPA plan to have this event go ahead later, hopefully within the next 1-2 months once we feel the health of all who attend will not be jeopardised by COVID-19. ⁠We will advise you as soon as we have a confirmed date.⁠
⁠
Regarding your ticket purchase, ticket holders may hold their tickets to use on the new event date or VPA can issue you a refund of your ticket. Regarding any ticket inquiries, please contact our Customer Service Team.⁠
⁠
We truly apologise for the inconvenience to those who have been looking forward to this event and ask for your kind understanding.

Nothing's better than preparing your favourite healthy snacks with your bestie, right @dallas_thom and @bec_guiliani? 👯‍♂️⁠
⁠
"Salted Caramel Almond Protein Balls ✨⁠
⁠
These protein balls went off this week in the kitchen 💥. Bec & I had so much fun making these energy bites we couldn’t wait to share them with you! These balls are vegan, gluten-free, oil-free and made with only 7 ingredients. Made in 15 minutes you can quickly whip up a batch so you can have these energy bites all week long!⁠
⁠
Makes 18 balls⁠
Prep time: 15 minutes⁠
96cals per serve⁠
C12g | F3.8g | P4g⁠
⁠
You need:⁠
• ¼ cup flax seeds⁠
• ¼ cup hemp seeds⁠
• ½ GF rolled oats⁠
• ½ cup almonds, plus 2 tbs for rolling⁠
• 200g pitted dates, roughly chopped⁠
• 1 tsp vanilla⁠
• 3 tbs VPA Salted Caramel Plant Protein powder ⁠
• 2-3 tbs water⁠
⁠
How to:⁠
1. Chop 2 tbs of almonds into small pieces (for rolling), set aside.⁠
2. Add the flaxseeds to a high-speed blender and blitz until the seeds are a fine consistency (this allows for proper absorption of nutrients and makes them easier to digest).⁠
3. Add all the remaining ingredients except the water and blitz until mixture is finely processed. Add water little bits at a time until a dough consistency is reached.⁠
4. Roll into balls and place on a plate.⁠
5. Place balls in the fridge for a least 30 minutes to set. Store these in the fridge.⁠
Enjoy! 😋"

Happy World Vegan Day! 💚  Thinking of starting your vegan journey but don't know how or where to start?  Here are some tips from our VPA Ambassador @dallas_thom 💪🏻⁠
⁠
⁠
🌱 Focus on eating a wide variety of plant sources like fruits, vegetables, legumes, whole grains, and nuts and seeds in their whole form. ⁠
🌱 Instead of focusing on what you can't eat, focus on what you can eat - once you open your mind to the idea of including more plants into your diet you will start to notice all the different options available.⁠
🌱 Be patient and give your body time to adjust to the changes - go low & slow. Just like we train our muscles we can also train our gut microbes to grow stronger.⁠
🌱 Start by having one plant-based meal per day. Breakfast is an easy place to start with a big bowl of oatmeal topped with some fruit. Yummo! 😋⁠
🌱 Have fun. This is an exciting journey as you explore new foods, flavours & textures. Get adventurous in the kitchen & try veganise your favourite meals like lentil pasta bolognese or chickpea curry. In not too long you will have some go-to recipes in your repertoire.⁠
⁠
Got some more tips? Share with us below!

We had a chat with our Ambassador of the Month @richy_evolve and he shares with us a few tips on how to stay healthy and fit. 🙌🏻⁠
⁠
"I think it all starts with mindset. You must have a positive mindset and try to be the best version of yourself. You have to set a clear intention/goal and be committed to it. It will be hard at the start and it will feel uncomfortable but once you make it a sustainable habit it will become easier and you will start to enjoy it! My top 5 rules:⁠
⁠
💪🏻 Positive mindset ⁠
💪🏻 Exercise at least 3/4 times a week and incorporate HIIT (30 minutes is enough)⁠
💪🏻 Healthy and balanced diet (80% healthy nutrient-dense food and 20% treats/snacks). If you can make it 90/10 even better!⁠
💪🏻 Enough sleep ⁠
💪🏻 Drink plenty of water"⁠
⁠
What are your tips on staying healthy? Share with us below!

Better than your average brownies, presenting the ✨Oreo Brownies✨ made with VPA's WPI in chocolate. Turn your favourite Oreo cookies into luscious, and protein-rich brownies! 😋 Recipe ⬇️⁠
⁠
Ingredients:⁠
1 cup Coconut Flour⁠
½ cup Coconut Sugar⁠
½ cup Cocoa Powder⁠
2 scoops VPA Chocolate WPI⁠
2 Eggs⁠
1 tsp Baking Powder⁠
1 cup Nut Butter⁠
1 Banana⁠
1 pkt Oreos⁠
⁠
Directions:⁠
1. Preheat the oven to 160º and line a square tin with baking paper.⁠
2. Brake up the Oreos into smaller bits. (or leave whole)⁠
3. In a large mixing bowl (or food processor) combine all ingredients keeping the oreos to the side.⁠
4. Once mixture is smooth add the oreos and gently mix.⁠
5. Transfer to the baking tin and bake for 30 minutes. ⁠
⁠

Here's a stunning Vegan breakky for y'all! If you've been meaning to spice up your quinoa meals then you definitely have to try this!⁠
⁠
✨Cacao and Peanut Butter Breakfast Quinoa✨ Recipe  by @_thedailyfoodfeed ⁠
⁠
| 𝗛𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝘁𝗲𝗶𝗻 | 𝗛𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝗙𝗶𝗯𝗲𝗿 | 𝗩𝗲𝗴𝗮𝗻 |⁠
⁠
- 50g tricolour quinoa ⁠
- 20g Lupin flakes ⁠
- 20g Premium Plant in Chocolate⁠
- 10g peanut butter powder⁠
- 1/2 tbsp cacao powder⁠
- Toppings: Yogurt, blueberries, cacao nibs and hemp seeds⁠
⁠
1. Rinse the quinoa and place it in a saucepan. Add the Lupin flakes, a sprinkle of sea salt and 1 cup of water, bring to the boil and simmer for 15 minutes or until tender and cooked through. Add more water if needed!⁠
2. Turn the heat off and stir through the protein powder, cacao powder and peanut butter powder. If the mixture is too dry, add a bit more water. Stir until fully combined⁠
3. Top with yogurt, microwaved blueberries and anything your heart desires 🤩 ⁠
⁠
Ps. This meal preps and lasts very well 👀  Tag your meal prep mate! ⬇️

In need of Anzac day recipe ideas? How about Protein Anzac cheesecake? YEA? 🤤 This Anzac day dessert recipe is purely decadent minus the guilt. Every bite is a combination of creamy, tangy taste of lemon, and the sweetness of caramel. Might I add, it is high in protein (made with WPI in Caramel). 𝗦𝗔𝗩𝗘 for later! 😋 ⁠
⁠
𝗜𝗡𝗚𝗥𝗘𝗗𝗜𝗘𝗡𝗧𝗦:⁠
200g ANZAC Biscuits⁠
75g Butter⁠
250g Cream Cheese⁠
2 scoops VPA Caramel WPI⁠
¼ cup Stevia⁠
2 Eggs⁠
¼ cup Lemon (Juice and Zest)⁠
⁠
𝗠𝗘𝗧𝗛𝗢𝗗: ⁠
1. Preheat the oven to 160º and line a cake tin.⁠
2. To make the base, blitz the ANZAC Biscuits and the butter to make a crumb. ⁠
3. Press mixture firmly into the tin and bake for 10-15 minutes.⁠
4. Blitz the remaining ingredients and pour over the base.⁠
5. Bake for a further 15-20 minutes and chill.⁠
⁠
Tag a mate who can't live without cheesecake! 🍰
