Why take Whey Protein Isolate? 🤔⁠
Taking whey protein supplements is a good alternative to meeting your protein requirements in your diet especially for athletes and bodybuilders. Taking whey protein supplements before or after exercise can improve muscle strength, lean-muscle growth, and immunity.
Who's part of this team? 🙋🏻🙋🏼‍♂️

⭐ AMBASSADOR OF THE MONTH: Naomi Ferstera ⭐⁠
@naomi_ferstera⁠
⁠
Naomi Ferstera is a graduate of Clinical Exercise Physiology and Education in 2009 and completed her post-graduate studies in Nutrition at Deakon University. ⁠
⁠
Today, she operates her own business specialising in the management of chronic diseases; namely cardiovascular disease, diabetes, dementia and obesity and believe that diet and exercise are two of the most powerful and under-utilised interventions we have.⁠
⁠
Naomi has also been accepted into UQs post-grad research program, where she will be starting her journey towards obtaining her PhD. “I hope to investigate the role that myokines (hormones secreted by muscle tissue during contractions) play in the prevention of dementia. This year I also celebrated my 20th year of working in the industry.”⁠
⁠
Naomi trains at World Gym in Ipswich (@worldgym.ipswich). "Gyms, weight training, HIIT and cardio have always been in my life to some degree. These days, I try to run a few times a week and I have just started learning Olympic lifting and CrossFit for something different.”⁠
⁠
Favourite VPA supplements:⁠
“I have two faves - I love the natural WPI – I have it every day. I tend to not use flavoured powders as I don’t like things too sweet so my favourite way to flavour the WPI  is with a small frozen banana, 100g of fresh strawberries and 50g blueberries. I also love creatine as it’s made a noticeable difference to my training. I just wish I’d started using it earlier!⁠

What makes VPA's Whey Protein Isolate the best in the market? ⁠
⁠
Clean whey protein isolates should have no fillers and protein content of about 90%. VPA WPI has only 4 ingredients, making in the cleanest whey protein isolate available.⁠
⁠
The ingredients of VPA whey protein isolate are whey protein isolate, flavour, sucralose, and natural colour. Each 30g serve of VPA WPI contains 27g of protein, making it 90% protein.⁠

What makes a good pre-workout? 😧⁠
⁠
Not all pre-workouts are created equal. When deciding on a pre-workout, be sure to read that the ingredients panel! Check that you are not buying something with ingredients that are banned by ASADA / WADA or illegal in Australia. If you compete in a tested sport, you shouldn’t take supplements, especially pre-workouts, without approval from a sports dietitian first. You should only purchase from a company that independently and regularly tests the safety and compliance of their products – like VPA!⁠
⁠

Easy peasy Choc Protein Mug Cake by @bodyisyourtemple 🧁⁠
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⁠
Serves: 2⁠
Low carb ✔️ high protein ✔️ easy ✔️⁠
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⁠
✖️Ingredients:⁠
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⁠
🍴 2 tbsp almond meal⁠
🍴 1 tbsp vpa protein powder⁠
🍴 1 tbsp cacao⁠
🍴 1 egg⁠
🍴 1 tbsp sugar free maple syrup⁠
🍴 2 tsp olive oil⁠
🍴 1/2 tsp vanilla essence⁠
🍴 1/4 tsp baking powder⁠
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⁠
✖️Method:⁠
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⁠
Mix all ingredients together in a bowl. Pour into a mug. Microwave on high for 60 seconds (make sure you watch the mug as the muffin rises). Check on the cake and let it settle. Microwave for a further 20 seconds until cooked.⁠
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⁠
✖️For protein icing: Mix 30g plain low fat Greek yoghurt with 6g of protein powder (I used coconut paradise 🥥). Add yoghurt / protein as you please to make consistency thicker or thinner. Drizzle on top of mug cake 🤗⁠
⁠
Cals: 200 P: 14.5g C: 7g F: 13g

What are my protein requirements? Protein needs are usually given as how many grams of protein you need to eat, per kilogram of body weight each day.⁠
⁠
For example: The protein requirements of someone during general training is given as 1g/kg of body weight. This means, a female who weighs 60kg will nee 6g of protein per, while a male who weighs 90kg needs 90g of protein per day.⁠
⁠
Check out the table below to see the protein requirements of different groups of people. ⁠

Game Changing ARM Growth TIPS 💪🏼 by VPA Athlete, @vyncentchau_⁠
⁠
1️⃣ - Compound Movements⁠
⁠
If you’re a beginner you’re probably thinking, what? Aren’t most arm exercises isolation movements? Nope. You use your arms indirectly as a sub-muscle group in almost every compound movement from regressed to progressed exercises at its utmost basic forms such as the bench press (push-ups), barbell squat (bw squat), OHP, dips, pulldowns and the list continues.⁠
⁠
Focus on your compound movements to build overall muscle mass and accessorise with isolation exercises, not the other way around!⁠
⁠
2️⃣ - Tracking Progress (or lack of)⁠
⁠
You’re probably not doing this? Track the weights, sets and reps of your workouts. Then try and progress week by week. Adding volume means making it harder than the week before, either through extra reps, increased intensity, extra sets or even switching up the tempo of the movement. If you want to progress in anything, you need to track. Period.⁠
⁠
3️⃣ - Food (or lack of)⁠
⁠
If you’re a beginner, you’re most likely not eating enough to grow muscle mass. If you’re a hard gainer, I’d suggest starting easy and eat regular meals. Start with 3 meals per day then add an extra meal or 50-100g of carbs to each meal in order to grow. Progressive overload applied into your nutrition. To build muscle, you need to eat!

Why do athletes need Magnesium?⁠
⁠
Magnesium is an important electrolyte and is essential for athletes. It is critical for nerve and muscle function and is essential for maintaining bone health. Magnesium also acts in all the soft tissues cells and enzyme systems. It is involved in blood pressure, immunity, energy and insulin metabolism. Ensuring sufficient magnesium helps with optimal recovery, oxygen uptake and energy production. A magnesium deficiency may result in muscle spasms, nerve twitches, cramping and fatigue.⁠
⁠

Just how important really is getting your protein in? ⁠Proteins are responsible for building hormones and enzymes in our body while helping us keep our muscles, bones, blood, hair and nails healthy.⁠
⁠
They also help build and repair muscle to give you strength and mobility and increase fat burning. It maintains and repairs tissues helping to heal wounds and keep organs healthy. Protein is also responsible for making antibodies that optimize the immune system, helping to fight infections and diseases.⁠
⁠
Getting in protein and having the energy to train can be somewhat difficult at times but having these close by can help you push through the work. 🙌🏼

What does creatine do?⁠
⁠
As a both health and sports supplement, creatine is one of the most well researched and evidence backed supplements. In simple terms creatine increases the rate at which energy can be produced and used within our body. ⁠
⁠
Creatine helps you work harder and work longer by helping to replenish our energy systems. This increases peak power output, and this in turn has and this has several positive impacts on sports performance and body composition.⁠
⁠
Read more about Creatine on the link in our bio!⁠

Who's the BEET-500 for? ⁠

CREAMIEST PROTEIN OATMEAL!! 🤤😍😍⁠
Recipe by @thiccmummapig⁠
⁠
"Best texture of oatmeal I've ever had, and it's my first time making it! Super easy super quick!!"⁠
⁠
Oatmeal:⁠
- 1/3 cup quick oats - 2/3-1 cup water (depending on what texture you like considering the protein will make it thicker)⁠
- 1/2 scoop protein powder (any is fine! The most basic flavour is vanilla but I used the banana flavour from @vpa_australia, I always use this brand, but banana was the only flavour I had on hand)⁠
⁠
Toppings (can use anything really):⁠
- a little bit of unsweetened almond milk⁠
- 1/2 serve almonds (chopped)⁠
- 1/2-3/4 tablespoon Protein Peanut Butter⁠
- chia seeds⁠
- cinnamon⁠
- frozen blueberries⁠
- 1/2 banana⁠
⁠
Microwave for 90 seconds and that's it!⁠
⁠
I never thought I'd be using quick oats ever (because of my bad relationship with food), but it seems like it was the better option for this meal in particular for the texture. Quick oats are particularly better if you need an energy boost too!

High protein choc banana muffins 🍌 ⁠
by @bodyisyourtemple⁠
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⁠
I love having something sweet mid-morning or late afternoon but sweet often = low in protein! My solution? Make your own!⁠
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⁠
✖️ INGREDIENTS⁠
▫️1 mashed banana.⁠
▫️1/4 cup almond milk⁠
▫️1 egg.⁠
▫️1 tsp baking powder⁠
▫️1 cup oat flour⁠
▫️1/3 cup coconut flour⁠
▫️1 tsp vanilla essence.⁠
▫️1 scoop @vpa_australia vanilla WPI⁠
▫️1 scoop @vpa_australia choc coconut protein powder ▫️1 tsp cinnamon⁠
▫️2 tbsp maple syrup.⁠
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⁠
✖️METHOD.⁠
▫️ Combine wet ingredients.⁠
▫️ Combine dry ingredients and mix through with wet ingredients.⁠
▫️Pour into muffin tins and bake at 180 degrees for 20-30 mins until golden ✨⁠
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ⠀⁠
Enjoy!

Our Ambassador of the Month is Emma Bowman ⁠@emma_bowman__⁠
⁠
"I am a mum of 3 beautiful children and dedicate my time to being the best mum, athlete and coach that I can be. ⁠
⁠
I take a disciplined and passionate approach to training 5 days a week, purely with weights and with the consistent goal of bettering my physique for the stage of bodybuilding.  I love working with boss women & encouraging self love and empowerment."⁠
⁠
She holds two Pro World Champion titles for fitness and sport divisions within federation ICN and is the 2019 state IFBB PRO LEAGUE bikini champ.⁠
⁠
After competing successfully in 13 shows, locally, nationally and internationally at professional level, she continues to share her passion towards her female client base through general lifestyle changes in training, nutrition and mindset, along with being a competition and posing coach. Her private studio is based in Adelaide where she holds individual, group and online posing sessions. ⁠
⁠
She says, "I love being an ambassador to VPA and they have helped fuel me through all my competitions! I have fallen in love with VPA's natural plant based salted caramel protein and have their creatine and pre workout every day. ⁠
⁠
My favourite food is pizza, I have a dog called Percy, I would chase the globe for the sun if I could, I have a love of parrots, people who make me laugh and listening to nasty rap." ⁠
⁠
Emma Bowman Posing & Fitness Coach⁠

Hayden's Workout List:

1) High Knees
2) Front/side DB Lateral Raise
3) Push Up
4) Mountains Climbers
5) Squat Jump
6) Resistance Band Row
.
Equipment Required:
- Resistance band
- light hand weights (dumbbells, food cans or full water bottles can be used).
- Exercise Mat or towel (optional).
.
Instructions
- 40 seconds work: 20 seconds rest at each station
- 4 full rotations of the circuit will be completed with 30 seconds rest at the end of each rotation - Approximate duration 26-30 minutes.

Protein Carrot Cake 🥕🍰⁠
From @lisa.whitham⁠
⁠
Cake:⁠
50g grated carrot⁠
25g @yoproau plain yoghurt⁠
12.5g @vpa_australia vanilla protein powder⁠
25g self raising flour⁠
1 egg⁠
20ml Queens sugar free maple syrup⁠
1 tsp baking powder⁠
1 tsp vanilla essence⁠
2 tsp natvia⁠
Spray olive oil⁠
⁠
Frosting:⁠
15g YoPro plain yoghurt⁠
35g Lite cream cheese⁠
1 tsp chopped walnuts⁠
⁠
Cake:⁠
1. Pre heat oven to 150 degrees (fan forced) and lightly spray with olive oil a 10cm springform tin.⁠
2. Add the sweetener, egg, yoghurt, maple syrup and vanilla to a bowl. Whisk until combined.⁠
3. Sift the self raising flour, protein powder and baking powder into the wet mixture. Stir to combine.⁠
4. Pour evenly into the springform tin.⁠
5. Bake at 150 degrees for approximately 20-25 minutes.⁠
6. Let cool completely before adding frosting.⁠
⁠
Frosting:⁠
1. Stir the yoghurt and cream cheese together.⁠
2. Spread evenly over the top of the cake.⁠
3. Sprinkle on walnuts.⁠
.⁠
ENJOY! Don’t forget to tag me in your carrot cake creations 😋⁠
.⁠
Macros: C-27.6g, F- 9.6g, P- 25.1g⁠
Calories: 322⁠

Nitrate supplements – why you should be taking one 🧐👆🏼⁠
⁠
If you hang around the sports nutrition world you’ll see there’s a lot of fuss about nitrate supplements at the moment. This is because nitrate supplements have been found to have a direct and measurable impact on exercise performance. ⁠
⁠
The evidence supporting nitrate supplements is so strong, that they were recently promoted to being a Grade A supplement by the Australian Institute of Sport.⁠
⁠
Supplements are only rated Grade A when they have the strongest scientific evidence supporting their use.  Let’s look at how nitrate supplements work and how they can help your performance.⁠
⁠

Our Ambassador of the Month is @gracesheppard_ 💖⁠
⁠
Grace has been training in different sports.  She was an elite gymnast following a rigorous 32 hours a week training for 7 years starting from the age of 8. She continued training platform & springboard diving for 4 years, and trained the pole wault for another 4 years. ⁠
⁠
Now she is with F45 Cleveland and loving the F45 lifestyle! ⁠
⁠
How do you train? F45? Powerlifing? Running? etc. ⁠
F45, stair runs, and still try and do some gymnastics classes here & there! ⁠
⁠
What's your favourite VPA supplement / flavour?⁠
My favourite VPA supplement is the pre-workout Kleos, sour sherbet flavour 😍⁠
⁠
Achievements you're proud of:⁠
The achievement I’m most proud of is winning 3 Australian national titles when I was an elite gymnast. I’m also proud of the 25 chin ups I smashed out during a gym testing day and a 2 minute handstand hold!⁠
⁠
Anything else you think is interesting!⁠
I graduated from my bachelor of Justice Degree at the end of last year 😊⁠

Do you need L-glutamine? 🤔⁠
⁠
This super amino acid has strong muscle building properties, working to repair muscle fibers quickly and reducing recovery times between training. ⁠
⁠
L-glutamine can also boost immune cell activity in the gut, helping prevent infection and inflammation, as well as soothing the intestinal tissue.⁠
⁠

VPA Chocolate Protein Scrolls! 😋⁠

✨HOW TO FIND MOTIVATION✨⁣⁠
⁠
By @abbey.pt 🙌🏼⁠
⁣⁠
"It can be extremely difficult trying to find your motivation. You may be stuck at home or frustrated with this whole situation right now and just not feeling it. I’m going to share with you some tips for how to stay motivated so you can continue smashing goals⁣."⁠
⁣⁠
💗Visualise your goals💗⁣⁠
Seeing your goals everyday of the week will give you a constant reminder of your ‘WHY’. You can put up your goals on your fridge, desk, phone lock screen or even in your car. It could include pictures to have an emotional connection to your goal as well as affirmations and intentions. E.g. Putting an intention on your fridge “I choose to eat healthy foods”. ⁣⁠
⁣⁠
⁣⁠
💗Take Action & Don’t Overthink 💗⁣⁠
The more action you take to continue your goals the more motivation that will come when you begin seeing progress. Don’t overthink it, why should/shouldn’t workout? Should I put my alarm on snooze? etc. Stop wasting time debating with yourself, overthinking creates excuses. Everyone has obstacles during their day, don’t let it ruin your success. ⁣⁠
⁣⁠
⁣⁠
💗Create a Reward System💗⁣⁠
This could be internal or external. Internal could be the sense of accomplishment or achievement. On a piece of paper, write down how you want to feel after achieving your goal (e.g. more energy to play with kids, to not judge myself in the mirror) External can be rewards including having one chocolate for dessert only if you achieved your eating intentions for the day. It could be buying your new outfit in a different size because you achieved your fat loss goal. ⁣⁠
⁣⁠
⁣⁠
💗Change your mindset 💗⁣⁠
Create happiness in every situation, set the mood for your emotions and mental state. Practise gratitude, write down 3 things you’re grateful for. What would it be like if I didn’t have my job? My partner? Access to food? Even looking up YouTube videos, TED Talks and books - find that push. ⁣⁠
⁣⁠
⁣⁠

BAKED PROATS 😍 By @ljeanpt⁠
⁠
Here's the recipe:⁠
⁠
1 cup GF quick oats .⁠
2 tsp black chia seeds .⁠
Approx half cup almond milk⁠
.⁠
Approx half cup water .⁠
Cinnamon⁠
.⁠
Pink salt (few twists) .⁠
1/2 tsp baking powder⁠
.⁠
1 grated apple .⁠
1 scoop plant based salted caramel protein @vpa_australia .⁠
10 chopped almonds .⁠
2 tbsp coconut yogurt (I used mango Nakula) .⁠
1 tbsp honey⁠
.⁠
1/2 cup frozen blueberries⁠
.⁠
Put oats, chia, water & milk in baking tray and soak for at least 3 hours in fridge (ensure oats are just covered with liquid) .⁠
Preheat oven to 170 degrees .⁠
Mix in remainder of ingredients except for almonds.⁠
Mix well until protein is blended in 👌⁠
.⁠
Sprinkle almonds on top and whack it in the oven for around 30 mins .⁠
⁠
Serve with yogurt 😍😍⁠
⁠
Absolutely a delicious idea!⁠
⁠
⁠
⁠

Leg workout at home! 💦⁠
⁠
By @_samanthawicks ⁠
⁠
If you want to see more of Sam's amazing workouts, follow @balancedbible and get their Ebook!⁠
⁠
THE WORKOUT⁠
1. 4 x 15 Squats (you can change the weight to anything you have available! Even a booty band)⁠
2. 4 x 12 RDL’s // 2-3 seconds on the way down, 1 second on the way up. (Once again feel free to change the type of weight you used)⁠
3. 4 x 20 Alt Forward Lunges⁠
4. HIP THRUST SUPERSET⁠
⁠
Complete the following timings, 1 round🔥⁠
30s work/ 30s rest⁠
30s work/ 25s rest⁠
30s work/ 20s rest⁠
30s work/ 15s rest⁠
30s work/ 10s rest⁠
30s work/ DONE!⁠

Crunch Choc Slice⁠
⁠
🤤 This slice is next level. ⁠
⚠️ SELF CONTROL is needed!⁣⁠
⁠
Recipe by #ourplantkitchen⁠
⁣⁠
Makes: 10. Cals per serve: 308 ( P:16.5/C29.3/F:13.8)⁣⁠
⁣⁠
1️⃣ BASE:45g Almonds. 4 GF Weetbix. 2 x scoops Vanilla VPA PREMIUM PLANT PROTEIN POWDER. 50ml Coconut Oil. ➖ Blitz all together in mixed & pack into bottom of slice tray, make sure you push in down firmly and evenly and place into freezer.⁣⁠
⁣⁠
2️⃣ CHOC CENTRE: 60g rice malt. 85g soft dates ( soak an hr before if needed). 20g Cacao. 50g Nut Butter. 2 scoop x CHOC VP PREMIUM PLANT PROTEIN POWDER. 40g Coconut Oil ➖ Blitz in mixer, remove Base from freezer make sure it’s hard and add centre on top, push down onto base so it’s firm and even and place into freezer.⁣⁠
⁣⁠
3️⃣ TOP LAYER. 50g Cacao. 70g Coconut Oil. 100ml Rice Malt Syrup ➖ mix together ( it can be quite messy) or blitz and add the the top of slice. The top should be quite runny but that’s fine. Quickly put back into freezer to set 🤘🏻 ⁣⁠
⁠

THE easiest and tastiest post workout snack!🏋️‍♀️⁠
By @_happyherbivore
⁠
PB chocolate crackles 🥜🍫⁠
⁠
⁠
1️⃣ In a bowl mix 1/2 cup of coconut oil, 1/2 cup of cocao, 1/4 cup of maple syrup and 3 Tbsp of peanut butter (I use @mayversfood always). ⁠
2️⃣ In a seperate bowl mix 5 cups of brown rice puffs and 2 scoops of plant protein powder -optional (I use @vpa_australia for their cheap and delicious plant protein). ⁠
3️⃣ Pour the wet ingredients with the dry, press into a dish and freeze!⁠
⁠
Super super easy and delicious!⁠

125 Grams frozen Strawberries⁠

Our Ambassador of the Month is Brianne Mayne! ✨⁠
@queen.bee.fitness⁠
⁠
"I fluffed around at the gym for many years, walking on a treadmill, and pushing some light weights around, then my dog made me run with him one day and I fell in love with it.  I went on to do my first half marathon and got addicted to endurance training from there.  Triathlon was meant to be one race, but the variety was so fun I’ve kept it up. ⁠
⁠
I’m a runner and triathlete who needs to stay on top of strength training too – to stay injury free! I train outdoors as much as possible, but I also train at World Gym Maroochydore when I do weights.  The gym became important to stay injury free and I have recently worked hard to get my lazy glutes firing again and it has made a huge difference to my running and reducing my piriformis syndrome flare ups. We’re putting in a home gym soon, so I am pretty excited!⁠
⁠
Why do you love VPA?⁠
⁠
VPA was the first protein brand I tried back when they were still “Venom Protein”. I went all in with 5 kilos because I was excited to have 5 flavours to help with my fitness goals.  I was lucky to win a bag of ginger bread flavor at Christmas and it is still one of my faves! My other favourite products are chocolate protein mousse and vanilla WPC as it is so versatile!⁠
⁠
⁠

How good does this look? What a treat! Baked by @bodyisyourtemple⁠
⁠
Choc caramel protein muffins 😍🍫⁠
⁠
Ingredients:⁠
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⁠
- 1 cup almond meal ⁠
- 1/2 cup oats ⁠
- 2 tbsp olive oil ⁠
- 2 tbsp maple syrup or 🍯 ⁠
- 2 tbsp 💦 ⁠
- 1 two vanilla essence ⁠
- 3/4 raspberries (fresh or frozen) ⁠
- 1 🥚 ⁠
- 1 scoop @vpa_australia Choc caramel protein ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⁠
⁠
⁠
Method:⁠
⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⁠
1. Mix dry ingredients in blender.⁠
2. Add wet ingredients.⁠
3. Spoon into muffin cases and bake at 180 degrees for 20 mins!⁠
⁠

Our ambassador of the month is Leigh Holland-Keen!⁠
You can find Leigh at @leigh.hollandkeen on Instagram.⁠
⁠
Leigh has been a Strongwoman competitor for 10 years now. And is in the process of rebuilding strength to return to the sport after giving birth to her first baby. ⁠
⁠
She says, "I have always trained on my own, each house we live in (Partner serves in the ADF) I renovate the garage into my own gym. It makes it super easy with working shift work ( I work as a Registered Nurse) and I find it beneficial with having a new baby.  Being a new mum certainly comes with its challenges. Life changes as you know it and it can be difficult to incorporate fitness into your life. With multiple complications post birth, it has taken a little longer to return to strength training however since birth I started implementing core and pelvic floor exercises into my everyday routine. Walking every day helped me recover a little quicker. Majority of the time I wait for my baby to have a nap then I can quickly train, I try fit in training every second day but as a mum it can be super difficult!"⁠
⁠
Achievement she's most proud of! ⁠
⁠
Last August, I travelled home to Scotland and became the first woman to be awarded a full lift of the famous Dinnie Stones (144.47kg and 188.02kg each!). The previous woman Dr Jan Todd was awarded a partial lift more than 40 years previously. It was an incredibly moment surrounded by some of the world's greatest stone lifters.⁠
⁠
⁠
⁠

Break down barriers associated with mental illness by being on the move. ⁠
⁠
Studies show that exercise can treat mild to moderate depression as effectively as antidepressant medication—but without the side-effects, of course. Being active promotes all kinds of changes in the brain and promote feelings of calm and well-being. ⁠
⁠
It also releases endorphins! The powerful chemicals in your brain that energize your spirits and make you feel good. Finally, exercise can also serve as a distraction and a break from stress, allowing you to find some quiet time to break out of the cycle and release the tension that’s been building up. ⁠
⁠
How has exercise helped you manage stress and improve your mental health?⁠
⁠
#mentalhealth #exercise #fitness #stressmanagement #vpaaustralia⁠

How are you celebrating the last year of the decade?⁠
⁠
How about a towering tall stack of vegan Salted Caramel Apple Spice Protein Pancakes? 🥞🍎 🥞🍎. These are vegan-friendly, has no added sugar, a good source of fibre and protein!⁠
⁠
Photo and recipe by @nourishfulsabrina⁠
⁠
Ingredients:⁠
-1/2 cup of flour of choice (I used wholemeal) -1 scoop of @vpa_australia salted Caramel protein -A few dashes of Cinnamon -2/3 tsp baking powder⁠
-1/8 tsp salt⁠
-1/2 teaspoon of vanilla essence -1/2 cup of plant based milk (plus a bit more if mixture is looking dry) -Sweetener of choice (I used a 2 tablespoons of @rawearthsweetener)⁠
⁠
Instructions:⁠
Mix all the dry ingredients together in a bowl then stir in wet.⁠
Pour a palm sized amount of the mixture onto a pan on low-medium heat flipping each pancake once.⁠
Pop onto a plate add any additional toppings (I drizzled mine with some PB sauce 🥞 🥜)⁠
⁠
⁠
Enjoy this stack of goodness! ⁠
⁠
⁠

Is building a toned body and gain muscles a part of your fitness new year's resolution? You might want to try out our Muscle Gainer protein powder.⁠
⁠
Our Muscle Gainer is a comprehensive protein shake designed to help gain weight and muscle. It's an ideal post-workout growth shake! ⁠
⁠
Gaining muscle can be very difficult if, like most of us, you were not gifted with perfect genetics, you don’t have an insatiable appetite for food or you simply don't have enough time to prepare or eat the amount of food your body needs. However, despite such obstacles, it is possible to gain muscle when you give your body the nutrients necessary to build muscle. ⁠

What exactly are BCAA's and do I need them?⁠
⁠
Branched-chain amino acids are 3 essential amino acids: leucine, isoleucine and valine, that can be obtained through the food you eat. ⁠
⁠
They are essential in fueling your body for peak performance at the gym during extensive training and most effective for recovery and muscle support. ⁠

Full Body Burner Workout with Samantha Wicks 💪🏼⁠
⁠
4 x 10 Barbell Hip Thrust⁠
4 x10 Barbell Squat & Press⁠
4 x 8 Chin Ups ( Can add a resistance band or use a assisted chin up machine if needed)⁠
4 x15 Laying down Knee Tucks⁠
SUPERSET FINISHER⁠
5 x Sled Pushe Sprint⁠
5 Burpees⁠
4 x Sled Push Sprint⁠
5 Burpees⁠
⁠

Some very wise words for your Friday afternoon right here from Nick! @nick_arace⁠

"How soon after training do you drink your protein shake? 💪🏼🤔 More and more people are learning this, which is great, but the “20 minute anabolic window” doesn’t exist 😱 so don’t run red lights and race home to smash down a shake to avoid losing your gains 😂⁠
⁠

Great repost from VPA Athlete @haydo_kelly: ⁠
⁠
"Branched chain amino acids (BCAA’s) consist of three essential amino acids including Leucine, Isoleucine and Valine. Amino acids are the building blocks our body uses to make proteins. These amino acids are referred to as ‘essential’ because the body cannot produce them, unlike non-essential amino acids. During a dieting phase @vpa_australia BCCA 7000 Peach iced tea flavour is one of my favourite supplements to ensure I’m getting enough of these essential amino acids. Generally I dilute a large bottle of water with 1 scoop a couple of times daily and sip on this at regular intervals between meals, I find a steady supply of amino acids throughout the day helps prevent muscle breakdown and speeds up the recovery process. "⁠
⁠

@vpa_australia⁠

Have you tried our BEET-500 yet?WHAT IS BEET-500?⁣
⁣
BEET-500 is a pure powder made from concentrated beetroot juice with no preservatives or additives. The excitement around beetroot juice as the latest sports supplement comes from its high nitrate content. Nitrate is converted nitric oxide (NO) and acts as a vasodilator, opening blood vessels and allowing more blood and oxygen to be delivered to muscles. Nitrate may also reduce the energy cost of exercise and positively affect muscle contraction.⁣

Bulking Season is Here!!! Treat Yourself with these High Protein TIM TAM & CHIA SEED PANCAKES this holidays💪⁣
-⁣
INGREDIENTS:⁣
2 cups SR Flour⁣
1/4 tsp bi-carb soda⁣
1/2 tsp caster sugar⁣
1/2 tsp chia seeds⁣
1 scoop VPA protein powder (any flavour tastes amazing!)⁣
4 Tim Tams (2 crushed to fine crumb, other two just crushed for topping)⁣
1.5 cups milk⁣
1 egg⁣
1 tsp vanilla extract ⁣
a handful of raspberries⁣
-⁣
MIX DRY INGREDIENTS TOGETHER flour, bi-carb soda, sugar, chia seeds, protein powder and two finely crushed Tim Tams.⁣
IN SEPERATE BOWL, WHISK milk, egg & vanilla extract together.⁣
COMBINE dry and wet together. ⁣
-⁣
LADDLE, COOK (few minutes each side) & PLATE UP protein pancakes! ⁣
-⁣
Top away, with the remaining two Tim Tams and some fresh raspberries or choose own toppings!⁣

Here is a healthy Vegan protein recipe, packed with 4 scoops of Premium Plant protein. Loads of antioxidants from beautiful fresh raspberries and a sneaky teaspoon of beet 500.⁣
-⁣
(Vegan, Low Carb, Gluten Free, Dairy Free, Egg Free, No Bake)⁣
Ingredients⁣
4 scoops VPA Vanilla Premium Plant⁣
¼ cup Natural Almond Butter⁣
1 tbsp. Coconut Oil⁣
1 tbsp. Sugar Free Maple Syrup⁣
1 pkt Raspberries⁣
1 tsp VPA Beet 500⁣
2 tbsp. Coconut⁣
-⁣
Method⁣
In a food processer combine all but the raspberries and coconut.⁣
Once combines add the raspberries and gently mix through.⁣
Transfer to a loaf tin and press in.⁣
Sprinkle with Coconut and set in freezer.⁣
-⁣
MACROS (per serve)⁣
Cals: 66⁣
Protein: 6.8⁣
Fat: 3.2⁣
Carbs: 1.4⁣

Happy Pretzel Day! 26th April. He is a tasty Protein Bar drizzled with dark chocolate and topped with Pretzels.⁣
-⁣
Ingredients⁣
3 scoops VPA Vanilla Premium Plant⁣
30g Coconut Flour⁣
Pinch of salt⁣
1 tbsp. Sugar Free Maple Syrup⁣
70ml Almond Milk⁣
65g Natural Peanut Butter⁣
Topping-⁣
25g 80% Dark Chocolate (or sugar free)⁣
Pretzels⁣
-⁣
Method⁣
In a food processer combine all bar ingredients.⁣
Transfer to a loaf tin and firming press in.⁣
Set in fridge for 2 hours.⁣
Melt chocolate and drizzle over bars. Top with pretzels and chill for a further 5 minutes or until chocolate sets.⁣
Cut into 6-8 bars.⁣
-⁣
MACROS (per serve)⁣
Cals: 155⁣
Protein: 13.6⁣
Fat: 8.2⁣
Carbs: 4.5⁣

To celebrate Picnic Day in the States (23rd April), why not enjoy one of our favourite chocolate bars the Picnic Bar, with a healthier, protein packed twist. Delicious!⁣
Ingredients⁣
Caramel Layer-⁣
-⁣
¼ cup Dates⁣
2 tbsp. Oats⁣
1 tbsp. Peanut Butter⁣
Chocolate Layer-⁣
-⁣
½ cup Peanuts⁣
½ cup Rice Puffs⁣
3 scoops VPA Chocolate WPI⁣
100g 80% Dark Chocolate (or sugar Free)⁣
-⁣
Method⁣

Transfer to a loaf tin and press out flat. Chill.⁣
In a large mixing bowl combine all chocolate layer ingredients and mix.⁣
Press into tin over the caramel layer.⁣
Set in fridge.⁣
Cut into 6-8 bars.⁣
-⁣

Cals: 195⁣
Protein: 13.9⁣
Fat: 10.9⁣
Carbs: 8.8⁣

The new word on the block at every gym, bootcamp or fitness class is fascia. So your most likely wondering what the %#*% is fascia?⁣
-⁣
Fascia is fibrous collagenous tissue, which are part of a body wide tensional force system. In simple terminology fascia is a fibrous net of connective tissue, which surrounds every cell in the body and is heavily interconnected with muscular function. If you removed everything out of the body apart from the fascia you would be able to see an outline of the entire body. Fascia is a mammoth matrix that runs from the tips of the toes to the top of the head and is involved in nearly every organ and structure in between.⁣
-⁣

Got leftover easter eggs???⁣
-⁣
Ingredients⁣
3 scoops VPA Chocolate WPI⁣
100g 80% Dark Chocolate (or sugar free)⁣
4 cup Rice Puffs⁣
5 tbsp. Butter (reduced Fat)⁣
½ cup Maple Syrup⁣
Toppings-⁣
2 tbsp. Peanut Butter⁣
Easter Eggs (to top)⁣
-⁣
Method⁣
In a saucepan heat butter, chocolate and maple syrup until melted.⁣
Transfer to a large mixing bowl and add remaining cup ingredients and mix until combined.⁣
Press into a 12+ muffin tin and chill for 20minutes or until set.⁣
Top with peanut butter and eggs.⁣
-⁣
MACROS (per serve)⁣
Cals: 195⁣

For all the coffee loves, here is a tasty Keto brownie topped with a layer of baked cheesecake. You'll be in heaven! ⁣
(Keto, Low Carb, Gluten Free)⁣
⁣-⁣
Ingredients⁣
Brownie-⁣
70g Almond Meal⁣
70g Butter⁣
150g 80% Dark Chocolate (Low/No Sugar)⁣
1 tbsp Stevia⁣
4 Eggs⁣
½ tsp Vanilla⁣
1 tsp Baking Powder⁣
2 scoops VPA Rich Mocha WPI⁣
Cheesecake-⁣
250g Cream Cheese⁣
2 scoops VPA Rich Mocha WPI⁣
2 shots Coffee⁣
1 tbsp. Stevia⁣
⁣-⁣
Method⁣
Preheat the oven to 180 º ⁣
Melt the dark chocolate in a microwave safe bowl.⁣
In a large mixing bowl combine all brownie ingredients. ⁣
Transfer to a greased baking tin and bake for 10-15 minutes.⁣
In a food processer combine all cheesecake ingredients and top the brownie.⁣
Bake for a further 8-10 minutes and chill.⁣
⁣-⁣

Water makes up a significant proportion (45-70% this ranges between individuals) of a person’s body mass and this water contains a sizeable amount of electrolytes. For example, adipose tissue has a low water content (10%) and lean tissue such as muscle a high water content (76%), so the total fraction of water in the body is determined largely by the total fat content*. The water within out bodies are not present as plain water, they contain a wide range of electrolytes and solutes, they are dissolved in varying concentration in body fluids. The major cations (these are the positively charged electrolytes) in the body are sodium, potassium, calcium and magnesium; the major anions (the negatively charged electrolytes) are chloride and bicarbonate.⁣
-⁣

Easter is here. Ditch the supermarket hotcross buns for this healthier version. Enjoy them fresh out of the oven, still warm and lathered in butter. ⁣
⁣-⁣
Ingredients⁣
250g Spelt Flour⁣
2½ scoops VPA Vanilla WPI⁣
3 tbsp. Coconut Sugar⁣
1 pkt Yeast⁣
2 tsp Mixed Spice ⁣
150ml Almond Milk⁣
25g Coconut Oil⁣
1 Egg⁣
100g Dried Fruit (Optional)⁣
⁣-⁣
Method⁣
Preheat the oven to 180º.⁣
In a large mixing bowl, combine all dry ingredients.⁣
In a separate bowl whisk together all wet ingredients. ⁣
Slowly mix together the wet and dry until a dough is formed. ⁣
Let dough rest for 1 hour.⁣
Divide into 8 and top with a flour and milk cross.⁣
Bake for 15 minutes or until cooked through.⁣
⁣-⁣
MACROS (per serve)⁣
Cals: 234⁣
Protein: 13.3⁣
Fat: 4.9⁣
Carbs: 35.2⁣

"Heyyy peeps!! Have you already heard about beetroot benefits?⁣
BEET-500 from @vpa_australia is a pure powder made from concentrated beetroot juice with no preservatives or additives. The excitement around beetroot juice as the latest sports supplement comes from its high nitrate content. Nitrate is converted nitric oxide (NO) and acts as a vasodilator, opening blood vessels and allowing more blood and oxygen to be delivered to muscles. Nitrate may also reduce the energy cost of exercise and positively affect muscle contraction. 💪🏽 As a classified 'Class A' supplement (Australian Institute of Sport) BEET-500 has been found to have beneficial effects on performance for a range of endurance athletes due to its ability to promote blood flow and nutrient delivery. Bodybuilding and weight lifting athletes also find benefits from BEET-500 from its ability to promote muscle pumps. It also appears that athletes training or competing at altitude (a low oxygen environment) may have particularly good responses to BEET-500 (nitrate supplementation). Give it a try you won’t be disappointed!"⁣

WTF is BEET-500?⁣ And how does it increase my workout performance?⁣
-⁣
Beet-500 will increase your endurance, increase your muscle pumps, and deliver more nutrients to your muslces!⁣
-⁣
BEET-500 is a pure powder made from concentrated beetroot juice with no preservatives or additives, scientifically shown to improve athletic performance. The excitement around beetroot juice as the latest sports supplement comes from its high nitrate content. Nitrate is converted nitric oxide (NO) and acts as a vasodilator, opening blood vessels and allowing more blood and oxygen to be delivered to muscles. Nitrate may also reduce the energy cost of exercise and positively affect muscle contraction.⁣
-⁣
As a classified 'Class A' supplement (Australian Institute of Sport) BEET-500 has been found to have beneficial effects on performance for a range of endurance athletes due to its ability to promote blood flow and nutrient delivery. Bodybuilding and weight lifting athletes also find benefits from BEET-500 from its ability to promote muscle pumps. It also appears that athletes training or competing at altitude (a low oxygen environment) may have particularly good responses to BEET-500 (nitrate supplementation).⁣

Tired of raw treats but to lazy to start up the oven? Try these easy microwave cake bites. Each bite has less than 80 calories and almost 10grams of protein.⁣
-⁣
(Nut Free, Low Fat, Low Barb, Flour Free, GF)⁣
-⁣
Ingredients⁣
60g Oats⁣
2 + 1 scoops Vanilla WPI⁣
1 tsp Baking Powder⁣
1 tsp Vanilla⁣
2 tsp Maple Syrup⁣
2 tsp Olive Oil⁣
½ cup Pumpkin⁣
3 tbsp. Yogurt⁣
35g White Chocolate⁣
-⁣
Method⁣
Steam the pumpkin.⁣
In a food processer, blitz the oats until fine.⁣
Add the pumpkin, oil, baking powder, maple syrup, 2 scoops of protein and vanilla to the oats and mix until smooth.⁣
Transfer to a microwave safe dish and cook for approx. 2 minutes.⁣
Crumble the cake in a large mixing bowl.⁣
Add the yogurt and 1 scoop of protein until mixture starts to clump together. (add more yogurt if needed)⁣
Roll into balls and chill for 20 minutes.⁣
Melt the white chocolate and drizzle over the cake bites.⁣
-⁣
MACROS (per serve)⁣
Cals: 79.3⁣
Protein: 9.9⁣
Fat: 1.7⁣
Carbs: 5.4⁣

0THE FOUNTAIN OF YOUTH!⁣
Collagen is often referred to as the body’s scaffolding, as it is the protein that glues the body together and one of the most abundant proteins found in the human body.“It’s the glue that holds the body together,” says New York dermatologist Whitney Bowe, author of The Beauty of Dirty Skin: The Surprising Science of Looking and Feeling Radiant from the Inside Out.⁣
-⁣
Whitney says that collagen supplies the volume that keeps your skin looking plump and prevents ageing lines. It’s also very high in the important amino acids proline and glycine, which work to repair your tendons, bones, and joints, extremely important for athletes and as you grow older. “As we get older, we break it down faster than we can replace it,” she says. Whitney Bowe learned only a few years ago that people were now eating collagen instead of injecting it to make their skin look younger, and she was sceptical. But she has since changed her mind after seeing the science and her client’s results.“Just in the last few years, there have been some impressive studies showing that ingestible collagen can indeed impact the appearance of skin,” says Bowe. In 2014 a study of 69 women ages 35 to 55 revealed that those women who consumed only 2.5 or 5 grams of collagen every day for 8 weeks showed a huge improvement in their skin elasticity, compared with those who did not consume the collagen. Another study confirmed this result and found that women who took 1 gram of collagen per day for 12 weeks had 76% less dryness, 12% fewer visible wrinkles and better blood flow in the skin.⁣

Healthy Choc Coconut Magnum Recipe 😍⁣
-⁣
Ingredients⁣
40g Yogurt⁣
40g Coconut Cream⁣
40g Cashew Nuts⁣
½ tsp Vanilla⁣
30ml Sugar Free Maple Syrup⁣
50g VPA Choc Coconut WPI⁣
-⁣
Coating⁣
35g Dark Chocolate⁣
1 tbsp. Coconut Oil⁣
-⁣
Method⁣
In a food processer blitz the Cashews and maple syrup until smooth.⁣
Add remaining ingredients and mix until combined.⁣
Transfer to magnum moulds and insert sticks.⁣
Freeze for at least four hours.⁣
Melt the dark chocolate and mix in the coconut oil before coating the magnums.⁣
Chill until set. Enjoy.⁣

Do you know the performance benefits of BEET-500?⁣
-⁣
BEET-500 is a pure powder made from concentrated beetroot juice with no preservatives or additives, scientifically shown to improve athletic performance. The excitement around beetroot juice as the latest sports supplement comes from its high nitrate content. Nitrate is converted nitric oxide (NO) and acts as a vasodilator, opening blood vessels and allowing more blood and oxygen to be delivered to muscles. Nitrate may also reduce the energy cost of exercise and positively affect muscle contraction.⁣
-⁣
As a classified 'Class A' supplement (Australian Institute of Sport) BEET-500 has been found to have beneficial effects on performance for a range of endurance athletes due to its ability to promote blood flow and nutrient delivery. Bodybuilding and weight lifting athletes also find benefits from BEET-500 from its ability to promote muscle pumps. It also appears that athletes training or competing at altitude (a low oxygen environment) may have particularly good responses to BEET-500 (nitrate supplementation).⁣

The recent excitement around beetroot juice as the latest sport supplement comes from its high nitrate content. Nitrate is converted to nitric oxide (NO) which acts as a vasodilator, opening blood vessels and allowing more blood and oxygen to be delivered to muscles. Nitrate may also reduce the energy cost of exercise and positively effect muscle contraction.⁣
-⁣
What is Nitrate?⁣
Nitrate is actually found in many vegetables, but the recent hype around beetroot juice is because of its particularly high content of nitrate. Yes, beetroot juice can be made at home with your favourite blender or juicer but you can get the best results from using a concentrated dose which is also much easier to consume for the same amount of nitrate (70ml vs. ~500ml respectively).⁣

“Use it or lose it” vs muscle memory, what happens to our muscle if we stop resistance training? Now exercise physiologists do agree that muscle memory is real, but the question is how are these ‘muscle memories’ stored when our muscles seem to shrink with inactivity?⁣
-⁣
According to a scientific review published in Frontiers in Physiology found that although our muscle cells shrink due to disuse, the nuclei gained during resistance training remains. Meaning that when we are young we are able to store muscle nuclei to prevent fragility in old age, but it also means that steroid use in competitive sport has long term benefits years after the crime was committed.⁣

What is BEET-500?⁣
-⁣
BEET-500 is a pure powder made from concentrated beetroot juice with no preservatives or additives, scientifically shown to improve athletic performance. The excitement around beetroot juice as the latest sports supplement comes from its high nitrate content. Nitrate is converted nitric oxide (NO) and acts as a vasodilator, opening blood vessels and allowing more blood and oxygen to be delivered to muscles. Nitrate may also reduce the energy cost of exercise and positively affect muscle contraction.⁣
-⁣
As a classified 'Class A' supplement (Australian Institute of Sport) BEET-500 has been found to have beneficial effects on performance for a range of endurance athletes due to its ability to promote blood flow and nutrient delivery. Bodybuilding and weight lifting athletes also find benefits from BEET-500 from its ability to promote muscle pumps. It also appears that athletes training or competing at altitude (a low oxygen environment) may have particularly good responses to BEET-500 (nitrate supplementation).⁣
-⁣

Junk food linked to severe psychological distress...⁣
-⁣
We all know what it feels like after we eat junk food…to summarise, you feel like you are operating at  20% of your normal mental and physical capacity. Well, this sensation may be more serious than a food coma after a cheat meal.⁣
-⁣
The International Journal of Food Sciences and Nutrition published a study by Professor Jim E. Banta, PhD, MPH found adults who consumed regular junk food were more likely to have symptoms of moderate or severe psychological distress when compared to similar adults who consumed a healthier diet, regardless of characteristics such as gender, education, age, marital status and income.⁣

These are no ordinary Pancakes. Loaded up with 48 grams of Protein these are the perfect post training fuel. With only 10 grams of Carbs there is plenty of room for more, so stack the berries sky high to make this the ultimate recovery meal. These pancakes are perfect for making in bulk or preparing ahead of time and reheating, no rubber frisbees here.⁣
-⁣
Ingredients:⁣
1 scoop Vanilla Premium Plant⁣
2 Eggs⁣
2 tbsp. Oats⁣
2 tbsp. Milk⁣
1 tsp Baking Powder⁣
-⁣
Method:⁣
Preheat a non-stick pan over a stove top.⁣
In a bullet blender, add all ingredients and blend until smooth and lump free.⁣
Transfer half the mixture to the pan, flipping when bubbles form. Repeat.⁣
Top with fruit, yogurt, sugar free maple syrup or maybe just your favourite Halo top.⁣
-⁣
MACRO (per serve)⁣
Cals: 380⁣
Protein: 48g⁣
Fat: 15g⁣
Carbs: 10g⁣

Easy, healthy and so delicious, these Pistachio Protein Balls are super low-carb and packed with 6 grams of protein per serve. With lemon, coconut and added multi greens these protein balls are light and zesty and are sure to be your jam.⁣
-⁣
(Keto, Lo-Carb, No Added Sugar, Peanut Free)⁣
-⁣
Ingredients⁣
120g Coconut⁣
120g Pistachios⁣
1 Lemon (juice & zest)⁣
2 tbsp. Coconut Oil⁣
3 scoops Vanilla WPI⁣
1 tbsp. Maple Syrup⁣
2 tsp Multi Greens⁣
1-2 tbsp. Water⁣
-⁣
Method⁣
Finely grate and juice one Lemon.⁣
In a food processer combine all ingredients, slowly adding the water until mixture comes together.⁣
Take about 2 tbsp. of the mixture and roll into a ball between your hands. Repeat.⁣
Chill and Enjoy.⁣
-⁣
MACRO (per serve)⁣
Cals: 112⁣
Protein: 6g⁣
Fat: 9g⁣
Carbs: 1.1g⁣

This Chocolate Protein Pudding is thick and delicious with a secret ingredient..... Avocado! Keto friendly and low in carbs, this is a perfect post workout treat for those wanting something different to the usual protein shake.⁣
-⁣
(Keto, Nut-Free, No added Sugar, Gluten Free)⁣
-⁣
Ingredients⁣
1 Avocado⁣
1 ½ tbsp. Cocoa⁣
1 ½ tbsp. Maple Syrup⁣
2 tbsp. Coconut Cream⁣
1 ½ scoops Chocolate WPI⁣
1 tsp Vanilla⁣
2 tbsp. Chia Seeds⁣
-⁣
Method⁣
In a food processor combine all ingredients, keeping the chia seeds to the side.⁣
Once the avocado mixture is smooth and lump free add the chia seeds.⁣
Transfer to 2 single serve dishes and chill in the fridge until thickened.⁣
Top with your favourites ie. shaved coconut, nuts or fruit.⁣
-⁣
MACRO (per serve)⁣
Cals: 353⁣
Protein: 25.6g⁣
Fat: 23.0g⁣
Carbs: 8.3g⁣

Another amazing post from one of our favouite VPA strength athletes @itsjustloulou⁣
-⁣
"Every day I am thankful I took responsibility for myself because I CHOSE. ⁣
I chose to love myself rather than wallow in self pity and anger. ⁣
I chose my physical health over drinking to excess. ⁣
I chose my mental health over drugs to numb it. ⁣
I chose my life over wanting death. ⁣
I chose strength in every single way. ⁣
I chose to take the pain of healing rather than numb it. ⁣
I chose to remove everything and everyone toxic from my life.⁣
I chose to stop accepting invitations to people's drama. ⁣
I chose isolation so that I could heal and come back a better friend, a better partner and better mother. ⁣
I chose to take charge. ⁣
These things didn't just happen. ⁣
It took a lot of work. It wasn't comfortable, it was hard and the hardest part was admitting that I was the only one who could do something about it. The hardest part was to stop blaming everything else and start doing the work. ⁣
I look at where I am now, where my goals are leading me and I look at where I've come from and I'm infinitely proud of what I've achieved. ⁣
No one is going to save you. Start with taking just one step towards a better life and continue to take one small step a day..... One day you'll look back at how far you've come. It's worth the struggle. ⁣
These days I'm only interested in creating the life I deserve and the person my loved ones deserve. "⁣
-⁣

These Cake Pops are not just pretty, they are damn tasty.⁣
-⁣
If you are looking for a quick and easy, but healthy recipe this is the one for you. Mix, roll, decorate and you're done.  These cake pops have less than half the calories of a traditional cake pop and less than 4 grams of carbs per serve. You can enjoy a second (or third) guilt free.⁣
-⁣
(No-Bake, High Protein, Lo-Carb Gluten Free)⁣
-⁣
Ingredients⁣
½ cup Cashews⁣
½ cup Almond Meal⁣
½ cup Almonds⁣
3 scoops VPA Chocolate WPI⁣
2 tbsp. Cocoa⁣
55g Dates⁣
1 tsp Vanilla⁣
3-4 tbsp. Water⁣
1 tbsp. Coconut oil⁣
-⁣
Coating⁣
30g Dark Chocolate⁣
Sprinkles⁣
-⁣
Method⁣
In a food processer, mix cake pop ingredients until smooth and well combined.⁣
Roll into small bite size balls and chills for 15 min.⁣
Melt the dark chocolate.⁣
Push each cake pop on to a stick and roll in the dark chocolate.⁣
Top with sprinkles and chill.⁣
-⁣
MACRO's (per serve)⁣
Cals: 115⁣
Protein: 7⁣
Fat: 7.8⁣
Carbs: 3.8⁣

So you’ve just worked your ass off for over an hour at the gym, using your new smartwatch to track your calories burned, and as you are driving home you have the thought…”I should re-fuel my body ASAP”. But the danger of being so hungry and overly optimistic because of your endorphins may cause you to make a poor decision and ruin all of your hard work.⁣
-⁣
According to a new study from the University of Nebraska-Lincoln,  the time when you decide what you’re going to eat after a workout can dictate what you will eat and potentially undo all of your workout gains. In this study participants had to choose between an apple and brownie, and subjects we found to be more likely to favour the fruit when deciding before vs. after their workouts.⁣
-⁣

This Tropical Cheesecake is a great twist on the classic baked cheesecake. The cheesecake layer is beautifully flavoured with Banana protein and topped with a delicious Mango/Passionfruit flavoured BCAA's Jelly.⁣
-⁣
(Low-Carb, Keto, Flour Free, No added Sugar)⁣
-⁣
Ingredients⁣
Base⁣
1 ½ cup Almond Meal⁣
4 tbsp. Sugar-Free Maple Syrup⁣
½ cup Almond Butter (Natural)⁣
-⁣
Middle⁣
250g Light Cream Cheese⁣
3 scoops VPA Banana WPI⁣
3 Eggs⁣
2 tbsp. Stevia (optional)⁣
-⁣
Top⁣
2 tsp Gelatine⁣
500ml Water⁣
2 scoops VPA Mango Passionfruit BCAA's⁣
-⁣
Method⁣
Pre-heat the oven to 180º. Line and grease a spring form tin.⁣
Combine the base ingredients and press into baking tin. Bake for 15 min.⁣
In a food processer mix the cheesecake ingredients until well combined. Bake for 20 min.⁣
Once bake allow cheesecake to cool before topping with jelly.⁣
To make jelly layer, mix the gelatine and 250ml of hot water. Combine the BCAA's and remaining 250ml of room temp water. Add the BCCA's to the gelatine mixture and top the chilled cheesecake.⁣
Return to the fridge for 6 hours or until Jelly has set.⁣
-⁣
MACRO's (per serve)⁣
Cals: 209⁣
Protein: 15.8g⁣
Fat: 14.7g⁣
Carbs: 2.1⁣

We see a variety of squats in the gym every day! We see boxes, bands, wide stances, narrow stances, no lock outs, heels elevated & the list goes on and on. But when it comes to squatting variables, a common one is the depth.⁣
.⁣
A squat is a compound, multi joint, full body exercise that engages most of the lower body. The motion will have you bend at the knees, hinge at the hip whilst keeping the back flat & torso upright. Whether its performed with bodyweight, with a dumbbell, kettlebell or barbell… It’s certainly a staple of most training programs. In saying that, we should want to get the most out of this exercise.⁣

😴 GABA QUICK FACTS 😴
1. Deeper sleep leading to improved muscle repair and cellular recovery.
.
2. Increase Growth Hormone production resulting in higher muscle mass and lower body fat.
.
3. Anti-Aging properties due to its hormonal stimulation.
.
Gamma-Aminobutyric acid or GABA is the primary inhibitory neurotransmitter in the human brain. In other words, GABA is responsible for reducing excitability in the brain, resulting in extreme relaxation and deep sleep. VPA’s GABA also has a strong ability to promote growth hormone production, increasing lean muscle tissue and fat burning. If that wasn’t enough, GABA also has anti-aging properties due to its growth hormone stimulation.

Sleep for Weight Loss…really?
With the long hours of work, commuting, family commitments, social activities and household responsibilities it is no wonder we are becoming more and more sleep deprived and living off caffeine.  According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, more than 35 percent of people are sleep deprived- which is almost identical to the statistic for obesity.  Connect the dots and you will see that the connection is no coincidence.
.
Our body needs 7 or more hours of sleep each night.  A study that was published in the Annals of Internal Medicine discovered that those bodies who received adequate rest experienced a 50% reduction in fat loss than the sleep deprived.
.

So we are 1 month into the year, how are your resolutions going so far? If you are like 92% of people you have probably already lost the fight, but there is hope! Let’s talk about how you can ensure that you Stick to your New Year Resolutions this year!
-
New Year’s resolutions have become synonymous with failure, so much so that 92%[1] of us will throw in the towel before summer is out. Why? Because resolutions are made for one main reason; to make us feel better about our current situation and hopeful about the year ahead. It’s a temporary motivational tool for the first few weeks of the year as opposed to a goal-oriented-plan for the year. But it’s time to stop with the resolutions and start with the lifestyle solutions.
-
If you are one of the millions of people into setting resolutions for the year ahead then there is a better than good chance that you probably didn’t exactly hit the ball out of the park this year. There is also a great chance that you didn’t really have any structured plan in place to do so either. So herein lies the question. Are you simply out to feel good by telling yourself and others that you have lofty aspirations or are you genuinely out to achieve something this year?
-
Let’s analyse both sides of the coin. To continue reading follow the link in our bio ☝️

Why you should be using creatine…Well, first of 
all creatine is one of the most studied supplements with more positive reviews than negative from research experience. Second, it is on the cheaper end of the spectrum when it comes to what supplements are available on the market. Third, is also not too much of a hassle to consume since the powder, the form which it is usually consumed, mixes well with several liquids and has almost no flavour.
-
THE SCIENCE
Creatine is a nitrogenous organic acid that occurs naturally in vertebrate and helps supply energy to all cells in the body, primarily muscle. Under quick bursts of force the supplement has been studied to act in a certain way; “Creatine has the ability to increase muscle stores of PCr, potentially increasing the muscle’s ability to resynthesize ATP from ADP to meet increased energy demands”.
-
In short, analysis has found that creatine treatment increased muscle strength and potentially improved functional performance. Feel free to research further as there is a large amount of information available on the internet regarding this topic.
-
Creatine Monohydrate is proven to increase physical performance in successive bursts of short-term, high-intensity exercise. This has obvious benefits for anyone participating in exercise – from bodybuilders and powerlifters to AFL and rugby players; who are all continually performing short bursts of intensive exercise. Creatine Monohydrate is the most widely researched sports supplement in existence.
-

A great post by Nutrition & Exercise Scientist @tyarranelson 🤘
-
"A common misconception is that you build muscle in the gym... whereas you actually break it down.
-
When we work out, the repetitive motions of lifting heavy loads result in minute muscle tears and acute muscle catabolism (breakdown). However, this is a GOOD THING, because it’s a physiological signal for our muscles to GROW. Following your workout, your muscles are incredibly sensitive nutrient uptake (particularly the amino acids from protein and glucose from carbohydrates). It’s these nutrients (in conjunction with sleep, a balanced diet with sufficient energy, adequate hydration and decreased stress) that help you RECOVER in the hours and days following your workout. These factors combined allow your muscles to repair, so they can grow to be bigger and stronger!
-
Remember, exercise is simply the stimulus. It’s adequate nutrition + recovery methods that ultimately change your body composition.
-
The current literature supports the notion of consuming ~25 grams of HBV protein 1-2 hours before and after your workout, to prime your muscles for growth and kickstart the recovery process. While this can be achieved by consuming any complete protein source, whey protein is an affordable, nutritious, convenient and palatable option. Give these 5 tips a try for developing your biceps 💪
-
1. Don't Work Biceps After Back
Your biceps will already be fatigued and you won't get the most out of them. Instead, try training them after chest. - 
2. Use include dumbbell curls
Again and again, science has shown that incline dumbbell curls are one of the best exercises for bicep growth because of the full range of motion and constant tension applied to the long head of the bicep. -
3. Make Sure Your Back Training Is Intense
Studies have shown a lat pulldown can work your biceps as much as curls do, so hit back hard.
-
4. Ease up on the EZ Bar
If your wrists allow, start doing straight bar curls instead of the popular EZ bar curls, they are great for building your biceps.
-
5. Fix your wrist
Similar to how the straight bar can greatly benefit your biceps because of your wrist position, be conscious of your wrist position during dumbbell curls. -

A great post explaining how caffeine and pre-workouts really work by @tyarranelson 💪
-
"I’m not entirely sure just how much caffeine has flown through my veins... but I do know that I LOVE @vpa_australia pre-workout 😛💪
-
As you may be aware, caffeine is the main ingredient in most pre-workout products 💊 However, caffeine does a whole lot more than just make you “feel good” ⚡️ In fact, caffeine is one of the most well-researched and powerful ergogenic aids (which means performance enhancing) supplements in the world.
-
Now, have you ever wondered what it is about caffeine that makes you feel more awake and perky? To understand we first need to clarify what makes us feel sleepy. As a result of daily activity a molecular bi-product called "adenosine" builds up in our system, which inhibits physiological processes and neurotransmitters associated with wakefulness, such as noradrenaline and serotonin. Caffeine is a central nervous system stimulant and is remarkably similar in molecular structure to adenosine. Caffeine can therefore bind to adenosine receptors in the brain and block their activity, which results in a higher level of alertness, concentration and energy expenditure.
-
Caffeine has been shown to enhance exercise performance with a dose of 3-6mg/kg of body weight consumed 1 hour before training. Caffeine can improve blood circulation, increase oxygen and nutrient delivery to your muscles, and can assist in higher levels of glycogen storage. This combination of factors can ultimately lead to greater power output, less perceived exertion and improved endurance during exercise!
-
Soo... if you’re looking for a top-quality pre-workout supplement which can improve your exercise performance, sustain your energy levels and doesn’t leave you feeling “crashed”, I would highly recommend checking out @vpa_australia ! "

CHOCOLATE TAHINI MUFFINS RECIPE 🙌
-
If you missed out on the Chocolate Cake Day, don’t stress. Here is the perfect recipe. These muffins are like no other protein muffin you’ve ever had. Super moist and super fluffy! Packed with Tahini, rich in minerals such as Magnesium, Phosphorus and Iron. You don’t need a better reason for it to be cake day everyday!
-
Add this to your favorites bake list because you will definitely want to enjoy this one more than once. -
Share your success with us on Facebook or Insta.
-
INGREDIENTS:
● 1 cup Pumpkin
● 1 cup Tahini
● 75ml Agave Syrup
● 1 tbsp Baking Powder
● ½ cup Cocoa Powder
● 2 tbsp Stevia
● ¼ +¼  cup Dark Chocolate ● 3 scoops Chocolate WPI
-
METHOD:
1. Steaming the pumpkin until cooked through.  Preheat the oven to 180.
2. Once add to a food processor along with remaining ingredients (keeping half the choc aside) and mix until smooth.
3. Line a 12 hole muffin tin and grease. 
4. Transfer mixture evenly into the muffin tray and top with the remaining choc chips. 
5. Bake for 10 min or until cooked through.
-
MACROS (Per serve)
Serving size - 107g
Protein - 11.7g
Carbs - 51.2g
Fats - 14.4g

😍 CINNAMON PROTEIN BREAKFAST MUFFINS 😍
-
Are you strapped for time in the mornings or simply love to sleep in before rushing out the door and skipping breakfast? Make these Healthy Breakfast Muffins ahead of time and you’ll never what to skip breakfast again.  Or if you are like me and enjoy training fasted in the morning, these are great breakfast on the go between gym and work. You can now pick up your morning coffee without “accidentally” ordering a banana bread or croissant, which is always is far too easy to do. -
INGREDIENTS:
● 2 cups Oat Flour
● ½ cup Coconut Sugar
● 1 tbsp Baking Powder
● 1 tbsp Cinnamon
● 1 cup Milk
● 1 Egg
● 1 tsp Vanilla
● 5 tbsp Almond Butter
● 1 cup Apple Sauce ● 2 scoops VPA Vanilla WPI -
Frosting
1 ½ scoops VPA Vanilla WPI
1 ½ tbsp Stevia
1 ½ tbsp Cashew Butter
½ tsp Cinnamon
Milk to combine
-
METHOD:
1. preheat the oven to 180.
2. In a food processor, blend oats into a fine flour. 
3. Add remaining ingredients to the food processor and blend until combined.
4. Transfer muffin mixture to 10-12 hole tray. (lined and greased)
5. Bake for 20-30 min or until just cooked through. 
6. To make the frosting combine all frosting ingredients. Add the milk slowly until desired consistency. 
7. Frost the cooled muffins and refrigerate.
-
MACROS (Per serve)
Serving size - 94.7g
Protein - 17.4g
Carbs - 23.2g
Fats - 7.9g
Cals - 252.5

Healthy Chocolate Cherry Cake Recipe 😍
-
Cherry season is here and in full swing! (in Aus) And with Chocolate Cake Day just around the corner on 27th January, what better way to celebrate than with a Choc Cherry Cake. This quick and easy cake is deliciously moist and packed with more than 13g of protein per serve. Without flour this cake has less than 5g of carbs per serve making this the perfect dessert (or breakfast, no judgment here) for those on a low carb or keto diet. -
Ingredients:
o 2 cups Pumpkin (Steamed) 
o 1 cup Almond Butter (Natural) 
o ½ cup Cocoa or Cacao 
o 2 scoops VPA Choc Cherry WPI -
Frosting- 
o 2 scoops VPA Choc Cherry WPI 
o 1-2 tbsp Stevia 
o 1-2 tbsp Almond Butter 
o Dash Milk -
Optional- 
Top with Cherries -
Method:
1. Steam the pumpkin until cooked through and blend in a food processer until smooth. 
2. Preheat oven to 180º and line a 20x20 square tin. 
3. Transfer pumpkin to a large mixing bowl and remaining cake ingredients. Mix until combined. 
4. Pour into cake tin and bake for 20-25 minutes. 
5. Combine frosting ingredients in a food processer, slowly adding the milk until thick but spreadable consistency. Allow cake to cool before frosting. 
6. Frost and top with Cherries. Keep refrigerated. -
MACROS (Per serve)
Serving size - 52.4g
Protein - 13.2g
Carbs - 4.3g
Fats - 9.4g
Cals - 168

Peanut Butter & White Chocolate Popcorn Recipe 🤘
-
If you missed Popcorn Day last Saturday (19th January) here is a great Vegan alternative to our Dark Chocolate Popcorn. Did you know that a large bucket of popcorn at the cinemas can contain more calories than a double quarter pounder? Eeek! If you love your popcorn but need a lower calorie Vegan version, we’ve got you covered. -
Ingredients:
o 2 cups Popcorn (Air Popped) 
o 1 tbsp Peanut Butter (Natural) 
o 1 Scoop VPA Vanilla Premium Plant 
o 1 square Vegan White Chocolate 
o ½ tsp Cinnamon -
Method:
1. Place approx. 1½ tbsp of popcorn kernels in a paper bag and microwave for approx. 1 min 30 sec and transfer to a mixing bowl. 
2. Drizzle the peanut butter over the popcorn and coat with protein and cinnamon. 
3. Melt the White Chocolate and drizzle over the popcorn. -
MACROS (Per serve)
Serving size - 34.5g
Protein - 17.2g
Carbs - 5.9g
Fats - 6.7g
Cals - 165 -

This recipe is a trusty favorite with a Cherry Spice twist that is guaranteed to bring out your inner child. With Rice Bubbles, Chocolate and Cherry you’ll enjoy munching on these Crispy Treats. Are these healthy enough to eat for breakfast? I’ll let you be the judge of that.
-
Of course, all of us at VPA would love to see any recreated recipes, so share with us at #vpaaustralia
-
Ingredients for Spiced Crispy Treats
o 3 cup Rice Bubbles 
o ½ cup Cashew Butter
o 1 tbsp Sugar Free Maple Syrup
o 1 tsp Vanilla
o 2 1/2  tbsp Coconut Oil
o 3 scoops VPA Choc Cherry WPI
o 2 tsp Cinnamon
o 2 tsp Ginger
o ½ tsp Cloves 
o ½ tsp Nutmeg
o 2 tbsp Molasses 
o 50g 80% Dark Chocolate -
How to make Spiced Crispy Treats
1. In a small microwave safe dish, heat the Dark Chocolate until melted. Set aside.
2. In a large mixing bowl combine remaining ingredients. (keep mixing it will slowly come together)
3. Transfer to a lined square dish and firmly press down. 
4. Dizzle the Dark Chocolate over the top and refrigerate until set. -

😍 High Protein Healthy Trifle Recipe 😍
-
This is a great healthy alternative to one of my favorite summer desserts, Trifle. This is perfect for any leftover sponge cake or jam roll you may have laying around after the silly season? 
With both BCAA’s and Protein Powder it’s the perfect post-workout treat. -
MACROS (Per serve)
Serving size - 151g
Protein - 33.3g
Carbs - 23.5g
Fats - 1.1g
Cals - 252
-
Ingredients for Healthy Trifle:
● 1 ½ cup BCAA’s Jelly (find the recipe on our Youtube page)
● 2 slice of cake (1 per serve) ● 1 tub Yopro Vanilla
● 1 scoop VPA Vanilla WPI
● Fruit to top
-
How to make Healthy Trifle:
1. At least 4 hours before, prep BCAA’s Jelly and divide between 2 glasses.
2. In a small mixing bowl combine the yoghurt and Protein Powder until smooth.
3. Top the Jelly with the yoghurt mix.
4. Add the Cake and top with favourite fruit.

PEANUT BUTTER PROTEIN COOKIES 😋 The perfect mid-week healthy treat!
-
1 cup peanut butter 
2/3 coconut sugar
2 scoops VPA Premium Whey vanilla
2 eggs
-
Instructions:
Pre-heat over to 180 degrees
Line baking tray with paper.
Combine all ingredients and mix until consistency resembles cookie dough. (Texture may vary depending on the peanut butter used).
If it looks too dry, add more peanut butter, if its too liquidy add more protein powder).
Scoop 2 tbs worth of batter and roll with hands. May need to wet hands with a few drops of water to keep the batter from sticking. 
Repeat with remaining dough, place them on the tray.  Use fork, press down gently on each cookie to create criss-cross marks.  If the fork sticks dip it in water as necessary. 
Transfer to oven and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges of the cookies slightly start to turn brown.
-

😍 Choc Popcorn Protein Treat Recipe 😍
In celebration of Popcorn Day this weekend, here is a tasty protein popcorn recipe to try. -
MACROS (Per serve)
Serving size - 34g
Protein - 14.3g
Carbs - 3.4g
Fats - 10.8g
Cals - 178
-
Fun fact- Those cheeky unpopped kernels are called “spinners” or “old maids”. Good quality popcorn should produce 98% popped kernels and only 2% spinners. -
Enjoy!  And of course all of us at VPA would love to see any recreated recipes, so share with us at www.instagram.com/vpa_australia/
-
Ingredients for Dark Chocolate Popcorn:
● 2 cups Popcorn (Air Popped)
● 1 tbsp Butter
● 1 scoop Caramel WPI
● 1 Square 80% Dark Chocolate
-
How to make Dark Chocolate Popcorn:
1. Place approx. 1½ tbsp of popcorn kernels in a paper bag and microwave for approx. 1 min 30 sec and transfer to a mixing bowl.
2. In a heatproof dish, melt the Butter and drizzle over the popcorn.
3. Sprinkle over the Protein Powder and mix until the popcorn is well coated. 
4. Melt the Dark Chocolate and drizzle over the popcorn.

Protein! Oh how I love thee. Start your weekend with these tasty treats!!!
-
PROTEIN CREPE RECIPE - 2 INGREDIENTS ONLY! -
INGREDIENTS:
1/2 cup Egg whites (roughly from 3 eggs)
1 scoop VPA Protein powder (all flavours work well)
Some fruit inside optional but recommended! -
METHOD:
Place a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. In a bowl combine egg whites and protein powder and whisk until protein powder is COMPLETELY dissolved and lump free. 
Scoop about 1/3 of the mixture if using a small pan, into the pan and rotate pan around so the batter spreads thin. Cook until the bottom is lightly browned and flip it over to cook through.
-
DISCLAIMER: These should be eaten immediately after making them!  They are so tasty while fresh but let them sit out for 5 minutes and they get progressively drier and harder.  Don't say I didn't warn you!

Great post from one of our VPA Powerlifting Athletes @the_barbell_brat 💪
-
"It's the time of year many people will make resolutions to change and a lot of those resolutions often revolve around becoming healthier which is great! 
With all the talk of body image and body positivity I want you to promise me something......
Start your journey from a place of love not hate for your body.
It is entirely possible to love your body and still want to change it. love how it moves, love how it progresses, love how it strengthens over the next year, love how capable you become, love how much faster you are, love that you look uniquely like you! Every scar, every dimple.
Take a holistic approach to the way you view "healthier" by reminding yourself that health includes mental health and that good mental health will only strengthen your ability to achieve good physical health. 
If you start from a place of love you cannot fail. To love yourself means you've already won in your journey to a healthier you. 
What is your new year's resolution?"
-

EGGNOG PROTEIN BALL RECIPE
-⠀
MACROS (Per serve):⠀
Serving size - 17g⠀
Protein - 5.3g⠀
Carbs - 1.3g⠀
Fats - 5.2g⠀
Cals - 78⠀
-⠀
Who is still chugging down Eggnog like it’s Christmas Eve? **Hand sheepishly goes up. ⠀
-⠀
Whip up a batch of these Eggnog Protein Balls so that you can enjoy that delicious flavour without the “I just guzzled an entire carton” guilts. ⠀
-⠀
With less than 75 calories and a nice 5.3 grams of Protein in each bite these are a great alternative to a glass of Eggnog and an even better way to wean yourself off if you are as addicted, as I’m am. ⠀
-⠀
Of course, all of us at VPA would love to see any recreated recipes, so share with us at www.instagram.com/vpa_australia/⠀
-⠀
Ingredients for Eggnog Protein Balls:⠀
o 1 ½ cup Almond Flour⠀
o 3 scoops VPA Vanilla WPI⠀
o 2 tbsp Stevia⠀
o Pinch Salt⠀
o ½ tsp Cloves⠀
o ½ tsp Nutmeg⠀
o ¼ cup Cashew Butter⠀
o ¼ cup Eggnog⠀
o 2 tbsp Sugar Free Maple Syrup Coating⠀
o ¼ cup Coconut ⠀
o 1 tbsp Stevia⠀
-⠀
How to make Eggnog Protein Balls:⠀
1. In a large mixing bowl or food processor, combined all ball ingredients. (if mixture needs more moisture add more eggnog but only bit by bit until sticky)⠀
2. Once combined roll into small bite size balls and set aside.⠀
3. To make the coating blitz the coconut and stevia until a fine powder.⠀
4. Roll the balls in the coconut mixture until coated. Keep refrigerated in an airtight container. ⠀

HIGH PROTEIN APPLE PIE SLICE 🍰⠀
This recipe is a cake, cookie, pie hybrid. If you love Apple Pie but don't have time to make the pastry whip this baby up in just minutes. Plus you’ll save on dishes. Need more reasons to get baking? What you’ll get is juicy apply scattered throughout a spiced cake with a beautiful crust edge. If you are not trying to watch your calories top a warm slice with ice-cream and homemade caramel sauce. Yummmmm!⠀
-⠀
Share your recipe success with the VPA team on FB or Insta @vpa_australia⠀
-⠀
MACROS (Per serve):⠀
Serving size - 49g⠀
Protein - 9.6g⠀
Carbs - 16.1g⠀
Fats - 13g⠀
Cals - 229⠀
-⠀
Ingredients for Apple Pie Slice⠀
2 cup Spelt Flour⠀
3 Apples⠀
1 cup Pecans ⠀
1 cup Apple Sauce ⠀
½ cup Coconut Oil⠀
2 Eggs⠀
3 scoops VPA Salted Caramel WPI⠀
-⠀
How to make Apple Pie Slice⠀
1. Preheat the oven to 180º.⠀
2. Peal, core and chop the Apples. Chop the Pecans and set to one side. ⠀
3. In a large bowl mix all ingredients except for the Apple and Pecans.⠀
4. Once well combined, gently mix through the Apple and Pecans.⠀
5. Line the base of a springform tin with baking paper and grease the edges.⠀
6. Transfer mixture into the tin and bake for 40 minutes. ⠀

Great post from one of the VPA team about finding the right training for your goals 💪 
@alexritchiefitness
-
"What’s the most effective form of training? .
You can go into the science of what gets you to your goals faster, weather it be bodybuilding, cardio, CrossFit.. but the one true answer is ‘What you enjoy!’
.
How many people out there look at fitness lovers and think “Wtf is wrong with them 🤔, that shit looks way too hard.” These people are doing it cause they enjoy it and that’s what helps them reach their goal. I personally think the same about people who love cardio 🤮
.
The most effective form of training is something you enjoy. Something you love doing. Something you can make a lifestyle out of. I constantly change up my training style. I keep it new and improved. I challenge myself in different ways.
.

HIGH PROTEIN BERRY, CHOC AND NUT COOKIES 🤤⠀
-⠀
Whip up a batch of these tasty cookies and snap a photo to share with the VPA team on FB or Insta @vpa_australia⠀
-⠀
MACROS (Per serve):⠀
Serving size - 32.16g⠀
Protein - 5.1g⠀
Carbs - 13.3g⠀
Fats - 4.4g⠀
Cals - 119⠀
-⠀
Ingredients for Berry Choc & Nut Cookie⠀
1 ½ cup Spelt Flour⠀
1 cup Oats⠀
¼ cup Cranberries⠀
2 ½ tbsp Walnuts⠀
40g Vegan White Chocolate⠀
½ cup Coconut Sugar⠀
5 tbsp Coconut Oil⠀
2 tbsp Sugar Free Maple Syrup ⠀
½ tsp Baking Powder⠀
½ tsp Baking Soda⠀
Pinch Salt⠀
¼ cup Almond Milk⠀
2 scoops VPA Vanilla Premium Plant⠀
-⠀
How to make Berry Choc & Nut Cookie⠀
1. Preheat the oven to 180º.⠀
2. In a large mixing bowl combine all ingredients apart from the Cranberries, Walnuts and Chocolate.⠀
3. Once a dough is formed gently mix through the Cranberries, Walnuts and Chocolate. ⠀
4. Line a cookie tray with baking paper and lightly spray with oil. ⠀
5. Take roughly two tbsp pieces of dough and roll into balls before pressing flat onto cookie tray.⠀
6. Bake for 10 min and Enjoy!⠀

Treat Yourself with these High Protein TIM TAM & CHIA SEED PANCAKES this holidays💪
-
INGREDIENTS:
2 cups SR Flour
1/4 tsp bi-carb soda
1/2 tsp caster sugar
1/2 tsp chia seeds
1 scoop VPA protein powder (any flavour tastes amazing!)
4 Tim Tams (2 crushed to fine crumb, other two just crushed for topping)
1.5 cups milk
1 egg
1 tsp vanilla extract 
a handful of rasberries
-
MIX DRY INGREDIENTS TOGETHER flour, bi-carb soda, sugar, chia seeds, protein powder and two finely crushed Tim Tams.
IN SEPERATE BOWL, WHISK milk, egg & vanilla extract together.
COMBINE dry and wet together. -
LADDLE, COOK (few minutes each side) & PLATE UP protein pancakes! -
Top away, with the remaining two Tim Tams and some fresh raspberries or choose own toppings!

HIGH PROTEIN GINGERBREAD COOKIES 🎄⠀
-⠀
MACROS (per serve):⠀
Serving size - 17.6g⠀
Protein - 2.3g⠀
Carbohydrate - 8.8g⠀
Fats - 2.1g⠀
Calories -  67 caL⠀
-⠀
Keep on track this Christmas with these delicious vegan Gingerbread Cookies, packed with protein and lower in calories. These little guys are sure to be a hit not just with the health conscious but anyone with a sweet tooth. If you like your Gingerbread with a bit more heat add another teaspoon (or two) of ginger. These are a great vegan-friendly cookie that can be decorated in the traditional way or go crazy with everyone's favourite, smarty buttons. You could even make a double batch (double because half probably won't make it to the cooling rack), pop a few in a tin and gift them to friends or family. ⠀
-⠀
Share your baking success with us on Instagram by tagging us at @vpa_australia ⠀
-⠀
www.instagram.com/vpa_australia/⠀
-⠀
Ingredients for Gingerbread Cookies:⠀
2 cup Spelt Flour⠀
2 scoops VPA Premium Plant Vanilla (SEE LINK BELOW)⠀
2 tsp Ginger (ground)⠀
2 tsp Cinnamon⠀
½ tsp Baking Powder⠀
½ tsp Baking soda⠀
½ tsp Cloves ⠀
½ tsp Nutmeg⠀
½ tsp Salt⠀
½ cup Coconut Sugar⠀
5 tbsp Coconut Oil⠀
3 tbsp Molasses⠀
¼ cup Apple Sauce⠀
2 tbsp Almond Milk⠀
-⠀
How to make Gingerbread Cookies:⠀
Preheat the oven to 170º and line a tray with greased baking paper.⠀
In a large mixing bowl add all ingredients and mix until well combined.⠀
Roll out the dough between 2 sliced or baking paper, approximately 5mm thick.⠀
Using a cookie cutter press out your cookies and transfer to baking tray.⠀
Chill in freezer for 10 minutes before baking for 10 - 12 minutes. ⠀

HEALTHY WHITE CHRISTMAS RECIPE⠀
-⠀
MACROS (Per serve):⠀
Serving size - 21g⠀
Protein - 5.9g⠀
Carbs - 3.5g⠀
Fats - 10.9g⠀
Cals - 144⠀
-⠀
Is it even Christmas day without White Christmas slice. I really enjoyed this slice as a child, blissfully unaware of hidden nasties I was consuming by the fist full (a slice in each hand, like every other kid). From copha to white chocolate and glazed cherries. ⠀
Ditch these highly processed ingredients and give this healthier version a go. ⠀
-⠀
Ingredients for White Christmas ⠀
1 cup Coconut⠀
1 cup Cashews⠀
¼ cup Coconut Milk⠀
¼ cup Coconut Oil⠀
1 tbsp Maple Syrup ⠀
1 tsp Vanilla⠀
3 scoops VPA Vanilla WPI⠀
70g Pistachios ⠀
50g Cranberries⠀
-⠀
How to make White Christmas ⠀
1. In a food processor blitz the Cashews and Coconut until super smooth.⠀
2. Add the wet ingredients and Protein and mix until combined. ⠀
3. Transfer the mixture to a large bowl.⠀
4. Roughly chop the pistachios and cranberries if you prefer them in small bits. ⠀
5. Add the pistachios and cranberries to the mixture.⠀
6. Transfer and press into a lined loaf tin. ⠀
7. Set in the freezer for an hour or so and cut into bite-size squares. ⠀

HEALTHY CHRISTMAS COOKIE SLICE RECIPE⠀
-⠀
MACROS (Per serve):⠀
Serving size - 48g⠀
Protein - 12.4g⠀
Carbs - 3.9g⠀
Fats - 12.2g⠀
Cals - 174.5⠀
-⠀
You’ll love this hassle free, No-Bake Cookie Slice. These tasty morsels are packed with a whopping 12.4 grams of Protein per serving and only 166 calories. ⠀
Baking…. I mean making cookies has never been so easy (and mess free). Save time by cutting out the bake time and no need to roll out each cookie, one by one, just press into a tin, frost and boom. These babies are ready to go. ⠀
-⠀
To make these nut free switch out the Cashew Butter for Tahini and Almond Milk for Coconut Milk.⠀
-⠀
Ingredients for No-Bake Cookie Slice⠀
1 ½ cup Almond Flour⠀
¼ cup Coconut Flour⠀
Pinch Cinnamon⠀
2 scoops VPA Vanilla Premium Plant⠀
2 tbsp Stevia⠀
½ tsp Vanilla⠀
½ cup Cashew Butter⠀
½ cup Sugar Free Maple Syrup ⠀
1 tbsp Almond Milk⠀
Frosting ⠀
3 scoops VPA Salted Caramel Premium Plant⠀
1 tbsp Stevia ⠀
¼ cup Almond Milk⠀
Sprinkles (optional)⠀
-⠀
How to make No-Bake Cookie Slice⠀
1. In a large mixing bowl add all base ingredients and mix until well combined.⠀
2. Transfer to a lined 20x20 tin and set aside. (tip- use another tin to press the dough out flat)⠀
3. To make the frosting, use a mixer or food processor to combine all frosting ingredients into a smooth mixture.⠀
4. Cover the base with the frosting and top with sprinkles (optional).⠀
5. Chill to firm up and Enjoy!⠀
-⠀
