A great post for the girls from one of our amazing VPA Athletes @jmac.attack⠀
-⠀
“MENSTRUAL CYCLE PERIODIZATION” 💖💞⠀
.⠀
Does your menstrual cycle affect your strength, endurance, and susceptibility to injury when training? You betcha, girlfriend. 🙋🏼‍♀️⠀
.⠀
While I’ve been researching, applying, asking questions, testing, measuring and creating content for my new “12 Week Women’s Only Training Program” (to be released 2019), I have learnt SO MUCH about the female body, hormones, and training during different phases of your cycles! 💕⠀
.⠀
I certainly don’t claim to be a doctor, gynecologist, or even an “expert” in this field, but being based as a Female-Specific trainer with bornformorefitness, understanding how to train my clients (and myself) EVEN better just increases my interest to learn and apply more and more of this helpful information. 🤓⠀
.⠀
In a world full of information (most very easily accessible/a little overwhelming), here are some quick facts about female-specific training that might help you along your journey: 💪🏽💪🏽⠀
.⠀
🌸 We women tend to be stronger in the Follicular phase of our cycle (two weeks following your time of the month) when the estradiol to progesterone ratio is high (hamstrings are stronger by 11%).⠀
🌸 Whether your goal is to improve strength, burn fat, gain lean muscle, the Follicular phase is the prime time for progression and maximal output.⠀
🌸 Insulin sensitivity is higher during your Follicular phase, which means your body will be more prone to using carbs to fuel muscle gains. 😏⠀
🌸 During ovulation, high estrogen levels can make women more susceptible to injury (single leg work, plyometrics, and glute/hamstring strengthening are best during this time).⠀
🌸 During the Luteal phase of your cycle (two weeks leading up to your time of the month), your body will rely more on fat as a fuel source."⠀
-⠀

HEALTHY CHOC CHERRY SLICE RECIPE 🎉⠀
In preparation for the release of our new flavour Choc Cherry I’ve come up with a delicious summer dessert packed with protein. Think chocolaty biscuity base, topped with loads or cherry ripe centre and a drizzle of rich dark chocolate. I know what you’re thinking right, Heaven! (and if you’re not, c-ya) ⠀
But seriously if you love yourself a cherry ripe bar, grab a bag of the new Choc Cherry and give this recipe a try. ⠀
-⠀
MACROS (Per serve):⠀
Serving size - 56g⠀
Protein - 7.4g⠀
Carbs - 9.6g⠀
Fats - 13.5g⠀
Cals - 203⠀
-⠀
Ingredients for Choc Cherry Slice:⠀
185g Digestive Biscuits ⠀
¼ cup Cocoa⠀
1 can Coconut Cream⠀
4 scoops VPA Choc Cherry WPI⠀
2 ½  cup Coconut (desiccated) ⠀
1 cup Frozen Cherries⠀
¼ cup Glazed Cherries⠀
50g 80% Dark Choc⠀
1-2 tbsp Pistachios (Optional) ⠀
-⠀
How to make Choc Cherry Slice:⠀
In a food processor combine Digestives, Cocoa, 1 tbsp Coconut Cream, 1 scoop VPA Choc Cherry WPI.⠀
Transfer biscuit crumble to a 20x20 tin.⠀
Set the Dark Chocolate to the side and add the remaining ingredients to food process. Mix on high until cherries are mixed through.⠀
Top the biscuit base with the cherry mixture.⠀
Melt the dark chocolate and drizzle over. ⠀
(Optional) Top with chopped pistachios.⠀
Chill in the freezer for 2 hour or until set. ⠀

SUPER LEAN PUMPKIN FUDGE RECIPE 🎉⠀
By now you probably know the secret ingredient is “voila” pumpkin. Pumpkin is one versatile vegetable for desserts and healthy alternatives. Don’t keep these beautiful veggies for soups, they are great for breads, brownies, muffins and now even fudge. ⠀
-⠀
Protein Fudge with almost half the calories and 6.2g of protein per bite. Sign me up! ⠀
-⠀
MACROS (Per serve):⠀
Serving size - 43g⠀
Protein - 6.2g⠀
Carbs - 3.2g⠀
Fats - 1.3g⠀
Cals - 56⠀
-⠀
Ingredients for Protein Fudge:⠀
3 cups Pumpkin⠀
1 cup Hot Water ⠀
1 tbsp Coconut Oil⠀
½ cup Cocoa⠀
2 tbsp Sugar-Free Maple Syrup⠀
½ tsp Salt⠀
3 tbsp Gelatin⠀
3 scoops VPA Choc Cherry WPI⠀
-⠀
How to make Protein Fudge:⠀
Boil the pumpkin until cooked through.⠀
Blend pumpkin and  1 cup of the water from boiling until completely lump free.⠀
Add other coconut oil, cocoa, maple syrup, salt and protein and mix until smooth.⠀
Slowly add the gelatin to the blender, avoiding lumps.⠀
Transfer mixture to a lined loaf tin and set in the freezer for 2 hours.⠀

GLUTEN-FREE HIGH PROTEIN FRUIT & NUT BREAD 😍⠀
-⠀
MACROS (per serve):⠀
Serving size - 110g⠀
Protein - 9.4g⠀
Carbohydrate - 25.7g⠀
Fats - 19.5g⠀
Calories - 305 cal⠀
-⠀
What’s better than raisin toast? A home-baked fruit and nut bread with scattered chocolate coated goji berries. There is nothing quite like the smell of freshly baked bread, except for maybe fresh bread slathered with butter.⠀
And thanks to Nodo this recipe is gluten-free. The Nodo Self Raising Flour has kept this bread perfectly moist,  making it hard to believe it’s even gluten-free. ⠀
-⠀
*For dairy free, swap the WPI protein powder for the VPA Premium Plant.⠀
-⠀
Share your baking success with us on Instagram by tagging us at @vpa_australia ⠀
-⠀
Ingredients for Fruit & Nut Bread:⠀
2 Bananas⠀
4 Eggs⠀
90g Coconut Oil⠀
425g Nodo SR Flour⠀
200g Dried Fruit (Apricots, Figs, Dates)⠀
210g Nuts (Macadamias, Hazelnuts, Pecans,)⠀
2 scoops VPA Vanilla WPI⠀
Pinch of Salt⠀
2 tsp Baking Powder⠀
100g Chocolate Coated Goji Berries ⠀
-⠀
How to make Fruit & Nut Bread:⠀
Soak the dried fruit in boiling water for 15 minutes. ⠀
Preheat the oven to 150º and line a bread tin with greased baking paper. (tip- leave an inch of paper either side to help lift the bread out.)⠀
Roughly chop nuts and drained fruit.⠀
Mash banana in a large mixing bowl. Add all ingredients and mix until combined.⠀
Transfer mixture to the loaf tin and bake for 50 minutes.⠀

GET INTO THE CHRISTMAS SPIRIT WITH OUR HIGH PROTEIN GINGERBREAD COOKIE RECIPE 🙌⠀
MACROS (per serve):⠀
Serving size - 17.6g⠀
Protein - 2.3g⠀
Carbohydrate - 8.8g⠀
Fats - 2.1g⠀
Calories -  67 caL⠀
-⠀
Keep on track this Christmas with these delicious vegan Gingerbread Cookies, packed with protein and lower in calories. These little guys are sure to be a hit not just with the health conscious but anyone with a sweet tooth. If you like your Gingerbread with a bit more heat add another teaspoon (or two) of ginger. These are a great vegan-friendly cookie that can be decorated in the traditional way or go crazy with everyone's favourite, smarty buttons. You could even make a double batch (double because half probably won't make it to the cooling rack), pop a few in a tin and gift them to friends or family. ⠀
-⠀
Share your baking success with us on Instagram by tagging us at @vpa_australia ⠀
-⠀
Ingredients for Gingerbread Cookies:⠀
2 cup Spelt Flour⠀
2 scoops VPA Premium Plant Vanilla (SEE LINK BELOW)⠀
2 tsp Ginger (ground)⠀
2 tsp Cinnamon⠀
½ tsp Baking Powder⠀
½ tsp Baking soda⠀
½ tsp Cloves ⠀
½ tsp Nutmeg⠀
½ tsp Salt⠀
½ cup Coconut Sugar⠀
5 tbsp Coconut Oil⠀
3 tbsp Molasses⠀
¼ cup Apple Sauce⠀
2 tbsp Almond Milk⠀
-⠀
How to make Gingerbread Cookies:⠀
Preheat the oven to 170º and line a tray with greased baking paper.⠀
In a large mixing bowl add all ingredients and mix until well combined.⠀
Roll out the dough between 2 sliced or baking paper, approximately 5mm thick.⠀
Using a cookie cutter press out your cookies and transfer to baking tray.⠀
Chill in freezer for 10 minutes before baking for 10 - 12 minutes. ⠀

VPA Athlete @cg_lionheart at only 75kg will blow your mind with some of the lifts he has been able to achieve!!! See his numbers in his recent post below 👇
-
💡 OCEANIA - Meet Recap💡 [ATTEMPTS]
- Squat
235kg ⚪️⚪️⚪️
245kg ⚪️⚪️⚪️
250kg ⚪️⚪️⚪️ (+2.5kg PR) NR
- Bench
140kg ⚪️⚪️⚪️
147.5kg ⚪️⚪️⚪️
152.5kg 🔴⚪️🔴 (+2.5kg PR) NR
- Deadlift
280kg ⚪️⚪️⚪️
297.5kg ⚪️⚪️⚪️ (+2.5kg PR) NR
305.5kg 🔴🔴🔴 (WR)
•
📈Best Performance ever to date📈
📉Definitely not an ideal Outcome📉
•
[SQUAT] Coming to this lift I was super confident since I am going conservative just to build a decent subtotal, every attempt was relatively easy w/ a bit of struggle. My form and execution was consistent throughout the attempts (3/3)
-
[BENCH] Never had any doubt with this lift since I’ve always hit all attempts on the past 3 competitions. 152.5kg was relatively easy for a 2.5kg PR, unfortunately bum came off the Bench which never happened before to me (2/3)
-
[DEADLIFT] My bread and butter for every meet. Midback was super tight from 2nd Bench attempt and I had massive cramps on Rhomboid and Lower Back, rolled that and had some Sodium - reaffirm myself I’ll be alright. Openers flew as per usual, 2nd was relatively easy but tore a callus into a blood blister, the 3rd was just out of reach since I’m gassed by then (2/3)
•
📊 OVERALL, for this meet I was aiming 700kg and would have got that arguably easy, the record attempt was kind of an Extra since I have nothing to lose. I would’ve grinded an RPE 11 had it left the ground, but my whole body went numb the moment I tried to budge it 😂 oh well next time that is -

✖Tip: Get in the habit of having them daily especially in between long periods of meals. I've been sipping on this mango passionfruit flavour which also gives me the benefit of something sweet whilst helping my muscles recover throughout the day. I also love my cardio so BCAAs stop muscle catabolism aka losing gains! Perfect for you early morning fasted cardio junkies like me 😋

Start your morning with this tasty and healthy chocolate banana overnight oats 😍
-
Don't let a busy morning lead a healthy diet astray! 
Prepare this the night before and it's ready to be enjoyed straight out of the fridge!
-
INGREDIENTS:
1 banana, cut in half
1 cup old fashioned oats (not instant)
1 1/2 cups unsweetened almond milk
4 tbsp VPA WPI creamy choc Whey Isolate protein
1/2 tbsp chia seeds
-
DIRECTIONS: Cut one half of banana in slices and mash the other half. Add mashed banana, oats, almond milk, protein powder and chia seeds into a bowl.  Stir well to combine, until all the protein powder has dissolved.  Seal container with a lid and place in fridge overnight.  Take container out of the fridge next morning, stir the mixture. 
Add more milk if you feel its too thick, portion into two mason jars or bowls and then top away!  I added banana slices, cacao nibs, pomegranate arils and activated buckinis for some extra crunch! -
ENJOY!

Who doesn't love Saturday Brunch! Now you can have the tastiest weekend brunch without blowing out your diet for the whole week with these tasty Blueberry Ricotta Protein Pancakes 😍
-
Delicately light and fluffy blueberry pancakes that melt in your mouth with a delicious sweetness and a hit of juicy blueberries!
-
INGREDIENTS: 
2 eggs
1 x 250g smooth ricotta
1 cup milk (i use almond but normal milk is fine)
1 cup self-raising flour
1 scoop VPA Protein Powder Vanilla
2 tsp baking powder
Pinch of salt 
1/4 blueberries for mix -
METHOD:
Whisk together the eggs, ricotta, milk until well combined and smooth.
Sift flour on top along with protein powder, baking powder and then mix until just combined.  Don't over beat the batter.  It will be thicker than normal, then gently fold in blueberries.  Heat non-stick pan over low-med heat and fry until golden brown, flip and cook remaining batter to make all pancakes. 
Serve with extra blueberries, [some fresh, some frozen (microwaved)], blackberries and walnuts! Maple syrup or honey over the top for some drippin' flavour!
-
THEN SMASH EM' - eat up!

THE PERFECT SUNDAY MORNING - HEALTHY BLUEBERRY RICOTTA PROTEIN PANCAKES
-
Delicately light and fluffy blueberry pancakes that melt in your mouth with a delicious sweetness and a hit of juicy blueberries!
-INGREDIENTS: 
2 eggs
1 x 250g smooth ricotta
1 cup milk (i use almond but normal milk is fine)
1 cup self-raising flour
1 scoop VPA Protein Powder Vanilla
2 tsp baking powder
Pinch of salt 
1/4 blueberries for mix -
METHOD:
Whisk together the eggs, ricotta, milk until well combined and smooth.
Sift flour on top along with protein powder, baking powder and then mix until just combined.  Don't over beat the batter.  It will be thicker than normal, then gently fold in blueberries.  Heat non-stick pan over low-med heat and fry until golden brown, flip and cook remaining batter to make all pancakes. 
Serve with extra blueberries, [some fresh, some frozen (microwaved)], blackberries and walnuts! Maple syrup or honey over the top for some drippin' flavour!
-
THEN SMASH EM' - eat up!
-

Kick start your weekend with this tasty & healthy Almond and Blueberry Smoothie 😍
-
This tastes incredibly delicious, a glass full of purple protein magic!
-
INGREDIENTS:
1/4 cup (80g) almonds
2 fresh Medjool dates (pitted)
1 cup frozen blueberries
1 cup milk (almond milk used)
1 scoop VPA Protein Powder Vanilla 
1/2 cup of ice 
desiccated coconut for sprinkling
-
METHOD:
Place almonds and dated in a bowl, covered with boiling water for 5 min.
Drain and place in blender. Add all the other ingredients & blend until smooth. 
Pour in glass, top with dessicated coconut or leave as is and DRINK UP! -

Shanes story is so crazy, that when I first heard it I didn’t believe it. So Shane was involved in a car accident when he was in his early twenties that left him 100% blind, no sight at all. After this happened he fell into a depression, understandably, but then was able to pull himself out of it and started in a relentless mission of self-improvement and growth.⠀
-
Despite set back after set back, and a lot of rejection he was able to become a qualified Personal Trainer, then started his own successful business, become a competitive bodybuilder, competing in major competitions including the Arnold classic and winning multiple trophies over the past few years. Along the way, he also met his lovely wife. He is now in preparation for his next bodybuilding competition and has his eyes on the National titles. So sit back and enjoy as I chat with Shane Falkner.⠀

PEANUT BUTTER PROTEIN COOKIES 😋 Get your treat fix while keeping it lean!
-
1 cup peanut butter 
2/3 coconut sugar
2 scoops VPA Premium Whey vanilla
2 eggs
-
Instructions:
Pre-heat over to 180 degrees
Line baking tray with paper.
Combine all ingredients and mix until consistency resembles cookie dough. (Texture may vary depending on the peanut butter used).
If it looks too dry, add more peanut butter, if its too liquidy add more protein powder).
Scoop 2 tbs worth of batter and roll with hands. May need to wet hands with a few drops of water to keep batter from sticking. 
Repeat with remaining dough, place them on the tray. Use fork, press down gently on each cookie to create criss-cross marks. If the fork sticks dip it in water as necessary. 
Transfer to oven and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges of the cookies slightly start to turn brown.
-

TIM TAM & CHIA SEED PROTEIN PANCAKES
-
INGREDIENTS:
2 cups SR Flour
1/4 tsp bi-carb soda
1/2 tsp caster sugar
1/2 tsp chia seeds
1 scoop VPA protein powder (any flavour tastes amazing!)
4 Tim Tams (2 crushed to fine crumb, other two just crushed for topping)
1.5 cups milk
1 egg
1 tsp vanilla extract 
a handful of rasberries
-
MIX DRY INGREDIENTS TOGETHER flour, bi-carb soda, sugar, chia seeds, protein powder and two finely crushed Tim Tams.
IN SEPERATE BOWL, WHISK milk, egg & vanilla extract together.
COMBINE dry and wet together. -
LADDLE, COOK (few minutes each side) & PLATE UP protein pancakes! -
Top away, with the remaining two Tim Tams and some fresh raspberries or choose own toppings!

MATCH GREEN TEA PROTEIN PANCAKES 🙌😋
Saturday Healthy Breakfast Sorted!!!!
-
BLEND: 
1.5 CUPS MILK 
1 X VERY RIPE LARGE FRESH BANANA
-
THEN ADD:
1 CUP PLAIN FLOUR
2 TSP BAKING POWDER
1/2 TSPN CINNAMON POWDER
1.5 TSPN MATCHA POWDER 
1 SCOOP VPA VANILLA PROTEIN POWDER -
BLEND SOME MORE, UNTIL MIXTURE IS SMOOTH AND SILKY, THEN LADDLE MIXTURE INTO PAN (NO OIL NEEDED IF NON-STICK, A LITTLE OIL IF NOT). KEEP TEMPERATURE LOW AND COOK FOR A MINUTE EACH SIDE. -
TOP AWAY!  FAIRY FLOSS PURELY FOR AESTHETIC VALUE (AVOID IF YOU DON'T WANT A SUGAR RUSH) 😊

PEANUT BUTTER PROTEIN COOKIES 😋
-
1 cup peanut butter 
2/3 coconut sugar
2 scoops VPA Premium Whey vanilla
2 eggs
-
Instructions:
Pre-heat over to 180 degrees
Line baking tray with paper.
Combine all ingredients and mix until consistency resembles cookie dough. (Texture may vary depending on the peanut butter used).
If it looks too dry, add more peanut butter, if its too liquidy add more protein powder).
Scoop 2 tbs worth of batter and roll with hands. May need to wet hands with a few drops of water to keep batter from sticking. 
Repeat with remaining dough, place them on the tray.  Use fork, press down gently on each cookie to create criss-cross marks.  If the fork sticks dip it in water as necessary. 
Transfer to oven and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the edges of the cookies slightly start to turn brown.
-
@vpa_australia
.
.
.

Looking for an easy way to repair your muscles? 🤔
Doing long distance training and want to ensure your muscles are supported? 🤔
Want to maximise your muscle recovery but don't want the calories? 🤔
Tired of having to mix a drink everytime you want protein after exercise? 🤔
If you answered yes to any of these questions, then what you are looking for ar EAA Capsules 💪
-
What are EAA's?
Essential Amino Acids or EAA's are a group of 9 amino acids (lysine, histidine, isoleucine, leucine, methionine phenylalanine, tryptophan, valine and threonine). These amino acids are essential because they can’t be made in the body and must come from food sources or supplements. These essential amino acids have been formulated at the perfect ratio to optimize your body for rapid muscle recovery.
-
Because of their simple form VPAs EAA's have the ability to digest into your bloodstream quickly and start working to repair and build muscles. If you are looking for faster recovery from intensive physical exercise, protect your muscles from catabolism, and wanting to fuel your muscles to get the most out of your training and physical performance than VPA EAA's are for you. *Complies with FSANZ.
-

15 fitness 'tips' that are doing more harm than good!
-
1. Myth: Exercise doesn’t help counter the negative effects of ageing.
2. Myth: A sluggish metabolism is the main reason you gain weight as you age.
3. Myth: To stay in shape, you need to work out only once or twice a week.
4. Myth: The best time to work out is first thing in the morning.
5. Myth: Weightlifting turns fat into muscle.
6. Myth: Puzzles and games are great workouts for your brain.
7. Myth: Exercise is the best way to lose weight.
8. Myth: Sit-ups are the quickest ticket to a six-pack.
9. Myth: Weight training is for men.
10. Myth: It takes at least a couple of weeks to get “out of shape.”
11. Myth: Running a marathon is the ideal way to get fit.
12. Myth: Keeping a food diary is a reliable way of monitoring and controlling what you eat.
13. Myth: Sports drinks are the best way to rehydrate after a workout.
14. Myth: Your body mass index is an accurate way to size up your overall health.
15. Myth: You need to sweat for your exercise to count.

Check out this interview we had with VPA Athlete @luke_douglass 💪
-
1. How did you get into health and fitness?
While deployed in the Middle East there were times I had to amuse my self, so I turned to heal and fitness. Educationally and practically ---
2. What are your current fitness goals and are you working towards anything big?
In regards to fitness goals, I am really focusing on educating the community around me I’ve done this by building my website that has free workouts and a forum.  learning more about different fitness modalities so I can take a more holistic approach to training.
---
3. How do you stay motivated to continue training?
Im guess I’m driven to lead by example as well as the saying “if you don’t use it you lose it”
---
4. What does your typical daily diet look like?
Breakfast - oats, frozen berries, Greek yoghurt, honey, almond milk
-Coffee
-Pre Training/Intra - VPA BCAAs, creative, Maltodextrin,
-Post Training - VPA WPI, Maltodextrin
-Lunch - 300g Lean meat, 1 Cup rice, 1 1/2 Cups Veggies
-Afternoon Snack - fruit, nuts & seeds
-Dinner - Meal Prep - 250g Meat, 2 Cups Rice/Carbs, 2 Cup Veggies
If I don’t make my macros for the day I have a night time treat 👌🏾
---
5. What’s your fav VPA product?
So hard to choose!!! I’d say BCAA’s and WPI - Rainbow ice cream flavour
---
6. What do you love most about VPA?
The quality of the products as well as the variety of flavours 🤤
---
7. What book has influenced you the most?
The Crossroad by Mark Donaldson, VC
---
8. What is one habit you are trying to change?
My sweet tooth 🙊
--- 9. In terms of money, what was the best thing you have bought or paid for that gave you the best return for your health and fitness?
My weekly shopping being meal prep purchase -
@vpa_australia
.
.

What are EAA's anyway? I am so glad you asked 😊
-
Have you ever wanted to get fast muscle recovery after exercise, but didn't want to stomach a milky, dairy-based protein shake? This is where EAAs come in 😎
-
What are EAAs?
Essential Amino Acids or EAA's are a group of 9 amino acids (lysine, histidine, isoleucine, leucine, methionine phenylalanine, tryptophan, valine and threonine). These amino acids are essential because they can’t be made in the body and must come from food sources or supplements. These essential amino acids have been formulated at the perfect ratio to optimize your body for rapid muscle recovery 💪
-
Who are EAAs for?
Athletes undergoing intensive exercise and need rapid muscle recovery. EAA Capsules are perfect for endurance athletes who want to supply their muscles the building blocks to recover but don’t want to have a milky protein shake. EAA Capsules are also perfect for individuals who are wanting to build muscle tissue and recover from heavy weight lifting quickly 💪
.
.
.

Compare yourself to who you were yesterday, not to who someone else is today...
-
Set the following goal: by the end of the day, I want things in my life to be a tiny bit better than they were this morning. Then you ask yourself, ‘What could I do, that I would do, that would accomplish that, and what small thing would I like as a reward?’ Then you do what you have decided to do, even if you do it badly. Then you give yourself that damn coffee, in triumph. Maybe you feel a bit stupid about it, but you do it anyway. And you do the same thing tomorrow, and the next day, and the next. And, with each day, your baseline of comparison gets a little higher, and that’s magic. That’s compound interest. Do that for three years, and your life will be entirely different. Now you’re aiming for something higher. Now you’re wishing on a star. Now the beam is disappearing from your eye, and you’re learning to see. And what you aim at determines what you see. That’s worth repeating. -Dr. J Peterson
